author: {'steamid': '76561197989150821', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1706484956}
review: I would not recommend this game to anyone who actually plays and enjoys real golf.  No matter how hard I try to replicate my swing, I cannot strike the ball with the same accuracy.  It is also worth mentioning that I can hit the ball in game to my real world distances by just flicking my wrist, and with just one hand.  In fact, I hit the ball better in game with just one hand than I do trying to make an actual swing.  I was hoping for this to be a mildly decent alternative to going to the course/range/simulator, but its not even close, sadly.  I'll have to find my fix elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112819846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 440, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1679095118}
review: I found this game over all to be lifeless and boring with too many issues to continue playing. As reported in the Steam discussions, there are several problems trying to play this game with the Valve Index. In order to teleport and move to the next shot, you must press different areas of the small touch pad on the Index controller. This is because the game was obviously designed for Vive controllers. Tracking is also very poor with the Index controllers where you will constantly miss the ball over and over again. I also got some gray screens when holding the controller a certain way due to the poor tracking. Mulligans are also tedious and time consuming where you must go to your bag and grab a ball then drop it into a circle on the ground then move back around to hit the ball. Graphics also have lots of aliasing issues unless you crank the multi and super sampling up then the frame rate takes a dive. This golfing experience is just too outdated now. I cannot recommend this game, but I can recommend a much better golfing experience called Golf 5 eClub instead.

review:
Very disappointing. Aside from the tree issue still not being fixed, most courses have a very bleak and depressing feel. Putting greens feel way too fast and slippery. Mulligans are tedious. Selecting clubs are tedious. Somehow all in one sports vr does golf better. 

Also when you're new to a course and can't see where the pin is, getting an overhead view or something is a must, but this seems to be missing. Also if your ball goes out of sight, there should be a camera that shows you where it's going.

review: The worst game I have played (or not played) in VR.  Just trying the tutorial was painful.  I cannot get the ball to line up to the correct view.  The ball is never in front of me regardless of how many time I teleport to it.  If I set the guardian where I am looking north surely the ball should be in front of me (north) to play a short west/east depending on left/right handed.  NO; its placed southeast (to my right and behind).  To be-able to play the shot I would have to turn around and step backwards.  This is not very safe while using a VR headset.  Tried the game twice over a  period of 2 months and I still have not played a single shot. I won't be trying again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198860454043', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1676949212}
review:
[h1] The Golf Club VR Review [/h1]


[b] Graphics: [/b] 8/15
Playable at best, difficult to see the green or the flag at farther distances. Still can see the fairway however.

[b] Gameplay:  [/b] 27/30
It is golf.

[b] Fun: [/b] 14/20
Frustrating at times, but i haven't actually played golf before getting this so it makes sense. Can be more fun to others.

[b]Replayability: [/b] 20/25
The Golf Club VR has a lot of courses but no progression or career mode.

[b] Hardware Requirements: [/b] 6/10
VR is inherently more harder to run.


[b] Overall: [/b] 75/100
The Golf Club VR is an amazing golf simulator, but its nothing more than a golf simulator. Beware that this game has not been updated for several years and is most likely abandoned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029153665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1655210673}
review:
[b]A very good VR golf simulation, somewhat let down by a distinct lack of gameplay options.[/b]


I don't play golf in real life, but I've always enjoyed golf games for some slower-paced, relaxing fun. What better format for such a game than VR? Not quite as "relaxing" as sitting in a chair, swiping a mouse or flicking a thumbstick, but the added immersion is surely worth the extra effort.

As a pure simulation of playing a round of gold, The Golf Club VR (TGCVR) does a very good job. The graphics are pretty good (by current VR standards), and the audio is fine. As well as ambience which puts you on the golf course, you can clearly hear when you've hit your ball cleanly and when you've buggered up the shot. The swing mechanics work very well, giving you full control and leaving bad shots as pretty much your own fault. (Played on Oculus Rift S. Other HMDs may vary.) Ball physics also seem pretty good, with bounces and rolls you would expect, although some greens can feel a little too slick in my opinion. Of the various golf games I've tried in VR, TGCVR is easily the most realistic feeling of the bunch, which does it credit.

Another great feature is the number of courses. There are a good number of dev-made courses to get you started. Once you've mastered those there are literally hundreds (thousands?) of user-made courses to have a crack at. It's here that you can find just about any course you want, from your favourite real-life course to complete fantasy courses that see you hitting your ball from island to island.

Where the game falls down for me is it's complete lack of features. As it goes for realism over arcade action, it's understandable that there are no trick shot modes, mini-games, high score leaderboards, or anything like that. That's fine with me. However, there is also no career mode, no tournament mode, no AI to play against, very limited multiplayer, no equipment upgrades, and no progression of any kind. It's just you and a completely empty golf course, devoid of any atmosphere, every single time you play.

For golfing purists the above might not be an issue, but it is for me. I like at least some sense of progress, at least some reason to play. A simple tournament mode with spectators clapping and cheering and a proper leaderboard would have been enough, even without the AI competitors actually being visible. (ie, like HB's 2D golf games.) Just something to make you feel like a pro, rather than a Billy-no-mates playing alone on an empty course on a Monday afternoon.

Put simply, TGCVR nails the act of actually [i]playing[/i] golf in VR, yet completely lacks everything else that makes a [i]computer game[/i] interesting to play. With that said, I don't like arcade rubbish so it's still the best VR golf game I've played. That, and the current low asking price, are why I still give it a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262095424', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2933, 'last_played': 1658072436}
review:
I almost never leave reviews... however I wanted to put some positive light on this game from my experience with it.

From my time playing the game (Oculus Rift S), I have experienced very few bugs, if any at all, although I cannot speak on other VR Hardware. The few "bugs" that I have experienced are quite trivial. The main "bug" is game crashes, however this only occurs when loading into a course, and happens very infrequently. As well, Since this also only happens when loading into the course it really has no affect on the game, as I can simply reload the game and load into it fine directly afterward. The only other bug I have noticed is that the drop zones after a hazard shot can be a bit "iffy" at points, outing you on the side of a cliff that is not playable, and forcing you to take the hole's shot limit. 

Outside of these two bugs, the game is fantastic. Almost any PGA course you could think of has been user created, from Pebble Beach to TPC Sawgrass, in pretty accurate detail. As well, the custom courses not based on "real courses" are incredibly creative and unique to play, hitting shots on and off of mountains and cliffs or from Island to Island. The game has so many created courses that you could end up playing a new course every day for a year and never run out!

As far as accuracy, that game may not be 1 to 1 of a real life swing, however consistency is still key. If you try and hit a shot, (and you are not on the beginning difficulty), accuracy is king, and getting your Iron and Driver's consistently down is a great feeling, from accuracy to speed. The putting and chipping is great as well, however I will say that it is hard to get the power of the chips down consistantley, especially from the different rough or sand traps as they can seem inconsistent at times. Putting however is great, though being a VR game, reading the greens is hard to do without the aided "green reader", similar to what you see in the 2kPGA games. You can take the time to walk the green and lay down on the ground to see the slops, however if you similar to me, we're playing in VR so we don't have to do all the tedious things like this.

As far as Online play, you can play online with others! You simply go to the course you want alongside your friends, and add them to your group, then press play. However, you cannot physically see them on the course. Alternatively, you can see their ball with a name above it, and their scores throughout the 18 holes alongside your own. You can also go head to head against friends or the leader-boards "best scoring's" on the course and see their shots as you take your's. The online is not perfect and probably doesn't equal alternative titles, but hopping into a discord and playing with friends is possible.

For me, Golf is a beautiful sport, however it's incredible hard to get into, from a difficulty point and price point. It's nice to be able to have the Golf itch and scratch it, without having to spend $30+ to go a course, and an additional 10+ to practice on a range before hand in real life. As well, after having a bad few holes I don't need to take the sad and slow grudge through the last part of the course, and can simply reset!

The game is not perfect, and from what I've seen the support from the game Developers seems to be long gone, but for the price and for what the game is, I believe its the best VR Golf experience you can get. I recommend trying it out, and if you don't like it or experience bugs with your hardware, simply refund it! The content this game has to offer is well worth the $10 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045164528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1653730578}
review:
Update 26 Feb 2022:

Personally, I like the game and especially the ambiance on the golf course. I don't regret that I bought it and still play it occasionally. I would not recommend it, though, for the following reasons:

1. The developers abandoned the game long ago. It's how it is, no bug fixes any more, no improvements, etc., and it would certainly need some improvements
2. It was a huge hassle to get the controllers working (WMR, HP Reverb G2), had to define special controller settings for this game. Not sure how I got it working, kind of, but can play now with my controllers. Read of people who never got it working
3. If you have an 11th or 12th Gen Intel CPU, the game only starts if you apply the fix described in the community here: https://steamcommunity.com/app/489600/discussions/0/3189115186362046917/

Although the game as such would be fine, maybe a bit outdated for 2022 but still okay, all the hassles and the lack of any support does not allow me to recommend it any more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169610767', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1632536130}
review: I was willing to give the game the massive lee way when it came to accuracy but I can't recommend it. It can be fun at times if you don't take it seriously at all. Your real golf swing doesn't mean anything in this game. Nor did I really expect it to. Any way, the range finder I can barely read at all. You hold your controller up to your eye and everything is super dark. Next you have this stupid stand bag follow you around, set right next to the ball and you constantly, and I mean constantly knock it over and have to teleport to ball to reset it. So you hit the ball and it gives you no indication that the ball has stopped rolling. So you sit there hitting teleport to ball for 3 minutes until it will move you. You can't change your clubs at all. So you have driver, 3 wood, 5 wood, 3-9 irons, pitch, sand and lob wedge and that's it. Next their "pro tee" simulator has a giant tree in the middle of it. I've read their license expired for it and instead of just removing it or ditching it entirely, the just put a tree there. Apparently this has been there for 2 years now? Seems like they had big intentions for the game and just said fuck it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021707941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1629407972}
review:
A good simulator type game, that is well worth having for anyone looking for room-scale VR games to add to their collection.  I'm finding that sport-based games make an engaging use of these platforms.

I play on an Index, and I personally didn't see any issues.  The default control scheme is for the Vive, but this all translates well to the index.  The only issue the index controllers have (and the same can be said for other sports titles) is that their design has them fixed in your hand, so adjusting grip angle is awkward.  Also, this game is probably more immersive if you fix a sensor to a real golf club, but I would be afraid of hitting something in my office/game room.  To each their own.

Improvements I'd like to see:  Quality of life/convenience features!!  Why am I being asked to bend over and reach into my golf bag to pick up a ball?  Same goes for grabbing a club.  I should have the option to automatically pull a club or ball from the bag without needing to walk or teleport over to it.  Its a game.  Players who want to really live that simulation can be free to do so.  I'm just here for fun.  Real PRACTICE modes!!  Give me a fun driving range, or putting green to practice game swing mechanics as much as I want, and separate this out from other courses.  Sure, I could mulligan every shot I don't like on a course, but I would need the ABOVE convenience features in place to make this not laborious.  Eleven (ping pong game) does this excellently.  Bigger range finder window/view.  Its uncomfortable and awkward to peer through a small telescopic view on a VR headset.  Just make it bigger and be fixed to my line of sight at the press of a button.  Its a video game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045617064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1627165287}
review:
The game looks ok but would expect better for the title having had a previous non VR golf title to work with as a base.

Starting from the teeing off. There are no tees so everything is off the deck meaning that the game is already off to a bad start for realism. Correct tee height is critical for doing the proper swing for each club so when your forced to use a driver off the deck every time it gets annoying as I can out hit the driver with the 5 wood most times.

Irons play stupidly short no matter the swing speed or shaft settings you choose. The shaft settings seem to make little to no difference to distance hit even when swinging in the desired swing speeds for the shaft. This is a real life customisation that actually makes a difference to flight path, trajectory and distance if paired correctly or incorrectly yet this game makes no distinction for anything when choosing this setting.

the penalty applied to the distance of a shot is again not realistic and seems to only take away from distance and not affect spin or direction at all which is just cringe when you.

Putting is far to fast with no feel for weighting given that there is a setting for this it is again disappointing. 

chipping is impossible as it has the same problems with irons only x2 for distance.

For a game that aimed for realism and a simulator approach with swing path analysis it is a total let down. As a real world golfer I would expect to have my real life skills at golf as a minimum on a game. This is not the case and I fear that anyone playing real golf that then puts the effort in to getting good on this game will only have ruined their actual golf swing due to this games lazy efforts.

only half accurate feed back is the swing analysis which tracks the path ok up until you get about 4 inches away from the ball and then you gain super powers to move the club head off of the swing path and back on to the same path on the other side of the ball. literally the most important part of the swing and it seems to guess what happens rather than track the movement. It is the fastest point of your swing so physically impossible for you to do what it says and flinch around the ball. since this is how the game calculates distance this is why it is unable to be played to any degree of enjoyment for some one who has actually played golf. It gives you 0% impact rating yet some how you hit the ball. 

Given that the game is using you hand in an unnatural position given the difference between a golf club grip and a VR controller it should have been coded in such a way that it smoothed out the swing path to take this into account. More effort required in the effects of rough, sand and tee height. Having also played their newest golf game I can safely say EA did a much better job 20 years ago with the tiger woods games for actual golf physics and that was before the days of GC Quad and other high tech trackers that these games could have used data from to enhance them. instead they seem to have their own version of physics and I doubt any one that worked on any of these golf games has played more than a round of mini golf.

wast of money waste of time just buy any other golf vr game and expect it to be arcadey as this one is a poor halfway house between Arcade and real life that misses on both fronts.

Don't waste your money if you have an Index.

The tracking is awful and the buttons are so bad for the Index. Don't believe me, look at the other negative reviews, they are mostly Index owners.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998389419', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1627181057}
review:
So far i've played about 9 holes on this game. I'm a relatively experienced golfer. Enough to actually play the game in real life with moderately good success. This game is very close to being awesome. I can tell that it may be limited by hardware at the time, or that the team should take another look at the swing evaluation. I'm using the valve index, and don't really notice any tracking problems. I have a swing speed of about 100-105 mph with a driver, but I refuse to swing that hard for this game. In real life my swing tends to come through with a bit of an open face with drivers and irons; in game its very heavily exaggerated. Though, can make adjustments for it and end up hitting a good ball. This applies to every club in the bag. 

I think the most accurate take on a golfer's ball spin in this game would have to be at the 2nd to easiest swing difficulty. This was disappointing, but necessary because of the club head tracking and calculating. This may be a result of using a single controller with 2 hands as compared to a real club, and I can deal with that. However, by far the largest problem is the distances in this game. A 4 iron only goes 140 yards? Seriously? I think this is because the game picks up that the club hits the ground on the way though. A huge weakness; you should at least be able to avoid it by resizing your clubs precisely. 4 standard presets would be fine if you didn't get punished for the dynamic resizing on the way through (The club will literally shrink in size to not go through the ground, but still results in "chunking" the ball). Not to mention, even with 100% clean contact, hitting off of anything but fairway results in 40-50% less power. They should take another look at that. Putting is not awful, but again it is different than real life because you are technically weightless, and the option to increase your "putter weight" only makes the logic worse. I feel that putting and short game around the green right now are the strengths of this game at this point in time; chipping especially feels real. 

I know that the game is early in development, and being a golfer, there's always that edge to hit a better shot. I just wish it was more rewarding! There's gotta be another way to handle the ground contact. However, this game is only $10.... Far, FAR worth it in my opinion, just to give another VR experience. The weaknesses right now do not take away from it's potential, whatsoever. It's still playable, just annoying at times to someone who actually golfs. Still an awesome idea, and I look forward to (hopefully) continued development and evaluation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004224922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 41, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1711489360}
review:
I got this about a year ago on the CV1 and refunded it as the tracking was making it impossible, but after a year and a still strong desire for a VR Golf game, I saw some reviews saying they were running it fine on Oculus (plus that one guy who has played 9000 hours....it must be good, right?), so I thought I'd try again. This time I set my two sensors up at right angles to me and angled to capture the full range of swing, as I thought maybe losing tracking at the top of the swing was the problem.

It seems to have solved the problem as I can get a decent swing out of it, I think the real issue here is that it's hard to know whether your swings are bad because of a tracking error or your bad skills, for me I'd say my absolutely pathetic golf skills are accurately represented here and for just £7, you can't complain really.

Put on a nice relaxing album to listen to like Campfire Headphase by Boards of Canada and this becomes really enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561199083331474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1623319700}
review:
2021/05/05 加筆修正

VR系のスポーツゲームをプレイしたく、比較的高評価が多いこのタイトルの購入に至りました。
チュートリアルでは途中詰まりましたが、実際に数ホール回れるところまでくると
他のレビューにもあるような素晴らしい出来だと実感出来ます。


以下　環境とチュートリアル詰まった箇所と解決。

プレイ環境はVive cosmosになります。
序盤のチュートリアルは日本語表示もあり比較的理解でき、Cosmos特有のトリガー押し込みで対応できます。
Cosmosのコントローラーのモデル形状は表示されますが一部ボタンが、
反応しない感じがします。

パターのチュートリアル直後の輪っかを覗いて距離測定を行うチュートリアル中に、
cosmosのコントローラーの形状から輪っかの位置が異なることや、
距離測定の赤丸印を覗き込むのかと勘違いし苦戦しました。

調べた結果 WindwosMR等で認識したことから本家 HTC VIVEと同じような位置を覗けば解決しました。
cosmosの場合はトリガー部分を覗き込むといった動作を行えばスコープ機能が機能しました。ジョッキで飲む動作を行うような感じです。

cosmosコントローラーのモデルに表示される距離測定の赤い〇カーソルはいくら合わせても意味はありませんので(´・ω・｀)

author: {'steamid': '76561198263753628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3973, 'last_played': 1618283911}
review:
Made a weighted club to hold the controller, played this all winter.  First game on the real course and topped the first 3 swings (2 mulligans).  The third swing being the only one that made it a reasonable distance from the tee box. 

 If you're buying this to keep your swing in shape it will do the opposite.  If you're buying it for pure entertainment, it's a lot of fun.  

The light rough is ridiculously unbelievable to swing out of and most of the swings don't register correctly.  We set up 4 sensors and had excellent coverage, but it was still too slow to pick up our normal swings.  Which meant you had to experiment with your swing until it actually worked, which probably isn't how you swing normally.

So fun yes, realistic no, and definitely will hurt your game if you don't go to a driving range before you hit the course.  My first game of the season was 8 strokes higher than my last game from last season... and several mulligans and some water balls.  

Either way it is fun. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198020135576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1619708064}
review:
I REALLY wish I could give this a positive review but it is not playable on Oculus devices.  I've heard it is not playable on Index either so....enjoy, Vive owners I guess?

Here are a few issues I encountered on Rift/Quest:

1. Centering yourself near the ball by holding the home button rarely works.  Often you are placed anywhere from 10-30yds away from the ball and you must manually teleport back with one of the worst teleport systems I've seen in any VR game.

2. Holding the controller up to your face for the rangefinder does not work consistently.  During the tutorial I was stuck at this step for a while until it randomly worked.  I have not been able to replicate that functionality so I'm not sure how you're meant to do it, but it obviously does not work properly for Oculus users.

3. The biggest/worst issue, and the reason I only have one hour in the game, is that tracking is completely broken.  The ONLY way to hit the ball with a Quest controller is to swing incredibly slowly.  If you swing as if it were a real golf club, you will miss the ball 100% of the time because the game CANNOT track the controllers properly.  On every attempt to hit a proper golf shot, the game would make a "whoosh" sound indicating that I had missed the ball, even if it appears that the club passes directly through the ball.  I tried several techniques, but in the end it seems you just have to swing too slowly for the ball to go anywhere.....So you're only capable of chipping on golf courses that require you to hit the ball much further than the measly 120yds of my longest shot after about 40 minutes of attempts.

I'm not sure how this game has positive reviews but I can only assume they're all from Vive owners.  If anyone has managed to get this working for Rift/Quest I would love to know how - out of the box it is not playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198866026799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3714, 'last_played': 1659108109}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025609238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1616635689}
review:
Overall it feels harder than real golf.  Which might be okay if there was a way to practice at something like a driving range.

There's no driving range to practice but there is a protee simulator.  But the protee simulator is blocked by a tree because their protee license ran out.  Yes the devs put a tree in front of the Protee Simulator because because their license ran out.   So instead of removing the feature or removing access to it in the menus, they just put a tree in front of it so you cant use it.  As a craftsman and builder of various things it makes me a sad panda when people don't take pride in their work.

This game is broken and abandoned.

Index controllers are not supported.

Refunded

author: {'steamid': '76561197971458836', 'num_games_owned': 1313, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1616092625}
review: I dunno, I've played for 7 hours and I'm still struggling to get comfortable...  No consistency, no contact with the ball, the system that adjust your distances to you is a great idea in theory but it makes that I can never choose the right club for the job, granted I'm not a golf player.  There's like a section where you're supposed to practice in from of the screen but there's a tree in the area that blocks everything, what's up with that... So I've decided to buy the golf game and it's already so much better in every way, it's not that I'm that much better but everything is just so much more fun and consistent, I can actually get better in the other one..!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999016257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2258, 'last_played': 1614396269}
review:
30+ hrs gameplay. I've played real golf for almost 20 years. 

Game needs lots of work. I don't think the developers have played golf because the distances the clubs are ALL wrong. For example, 3 iron goes 214 yards, 4 iron goes 185, 5 iron 186, 6iron 182, 7iron 167....the yardages jump all over the place. The ranges on the clubs are ALL off. I've read that these are supposed to update as you play, but after 40 hrs of gameplay, they are all still wrong. The 3 wood and the 5 wood got reversed.  3 wood hits 185ish whereas the 5 wood will go 236ish. If you hit into the rough in this game, its basically unplayable. No matter what club you hit, you'll maybe get 50 yards max. There is absolutely no way to stop or back up a ball, if you get within 10 ft on an approach shot, consider it the luck of the golf gods as you wont do that again in the round.  Every shot rolls out another 15-20 yards when the ball hits the green. If pin is in front of a green, you're screwed. Every par 4 plays like a par 6.  No multiplayer either. There is zero consistency in this game. One shot will go 10 yards, the same swing on the next will go 50. Real golf is easier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198869771128', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1644976769}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075739676', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1627246087}
review: Well, where to start.  Well, I REALLY want to love this game. It is horribly optimized.  I have a beefy system with a 2080ti, 9900K @ 5ghz and 64gigs of ram.  I cannot run this on anything other than LOW settings.  Anything higher and club swing becomes a stuttering mess. For a game made in 2017 I would have thought newer hardware could handle it no problem.  Mechanics are good. BUT, swinging a single controller with two hands (I have the Index controllers) results in a hook or slice every time. (I play golf IRL and this is not a problem I have) Yet, swinging with one hand yields a straight drive every time.  I think if the game performance were better this would not be as much of an issue. I can run games such as Half Life Alyx at 90FPS all day long with no issues.  This game on Medium settings barely runs at 25fps.   It's a wonderful idea, it has a lot of courses, but poor performance is the killer here.  And on low settings everything is a jaggie mess.  Too bad really.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091091803', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1638995734}

author: {'steamid': '76561198272708982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1612107703}
review:
Läuft perfekt auf der Oculus Quest 2.
Nach dem Lesen der Rezensionen habe ich gezweifelt, ob ich mir dieses Spiel kaufen soll. Bei dem Preis, hab ich mir gedacht, ich probiere es einfach aus und mache mir mein eigenes Bild.
Es hat sich gelohnt!
Für alle die noch Zweifeln, jedoch Golf lieben und eine Oculus Quest 2 besitzen gibt es von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung.
Ich spiele über Virtuell Desktop (ohne Link Kabel), habe eine GTX 1060 (6GB) und nutze einen Honor 3 (Wifi 6) Router. Prozessor i7 mit 12 GB Ram. Das Spiel läuft absolut flüssig und ist sogar überwiegend in Deutsch gehalten. Hier gibt es noch ein wenig Vermischung mit dem Englischen aber das sind Quest User ja ohnehin gewohnt. Immerhin kann das Tutorial auf Deutsch angewendet werden.
Das Spiel ist nicht ganz einfach zu meistern. Ich habe 2 Saison lang echtes Golf gespielt und kenne die Grundlagen. Die Weiten der Schläge in diesem Spiel sind schwer zu erreichen. Nun habe ich aber auch erst einen kurzen Test gemacht. Alles reibungslos und super Grafik und Sound.
Ich freue mich auf viele schöne Plätze und ein schönes Golferlebnis.
Wirklich sehr nahe an der Realität. Meinen großen Respekt für die Entwickler.
Also Quest 2 User, ihr könnt es unbedenklich kaufen und Spaß haben.
Im Übrigen stimmt es, dass auf der sogenannten Driving Range ein Baum steht. Was soll das?
Man steht mitten im Baum wenn man die Range nutzen will. Das ist ein klarer Fehler im Spiel, trübt aber das Spielerlebnis auf den Plätzen nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030458759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1611436597}
review:
I recently got a VR setup and heard this was the best golf game around, so I tried it out!! 
Last time I went in real life I had to get called to the tee, people watched me hit, I sliced it a lot, still had fun tho, and kept my composure.
With golf club VR, you get all this and more!!

Pros:
- no waiting or walking to ball
- no more waiting for the beverage cart, you pour em as you go!
- nobody to watch you shank it into the weeds
- User friendly and fairly accurate (accuracy may be a con too...)
- putter weight adjustable for more lifelike experience 

Cons:
- still didn't fix my swing, leading to shanking into the weeds
- couldn't tell the wife I was off to golf a round
- was too accurate at times and reminded me of being on a real course

Overall a really fun game and a great golf experience for all VR owners out there!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970378200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1189, 'last_played': 1706648818}
review:
Nice game.

It's buggy and apparently been abandoned by the devs, but I find it relaxing and more like actual golf than any other game. 
It's difficult, but there's a good feeling of being on the course and with The Golf Club course designer (that you have to buy separately) you can design your own courses.

Sure it's a fiddly game, but once you get the hang of it, I'd recommend it.  
Word of warning - my mate has the Oculus 2 and he's having trouble passing the tutorial due to control issues.
Can anyone confirm you can pass the tutorial on Oculus 2?

author: {'steamid': '76561198009384864', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1609336513}

Bummer, but I'll stick with the non-VR version for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314107182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1695506701}
review:
FINALLY GOT IT TO WORK...Thanks to the post by Codingus! The secret instruction that Steam should include on all of the VR product pages is this: YOU HAVE TO INSTALL STEAM VR for all of them to work! I found the same thing to be true for Google Earth VR. Again, thank you Codingus for getting this figured out and taking the time to post the solution. Now if we could just get rid of that tree!

I have all of The Golf Club programs and have created several course for TGC, TGC2 and 2019. You can imagine my excitement when I found TGC-VR! I spent $300 on an Oculus Quest 2 and $10 for TGC-VR. Unfortunately it wouldn't run. Screen came up with gray background and ground at the bottom. I was running an Nvidia GTX 960 graphics card (2GB), but I thought I would at least get something. So, I spent another $270 to upgrade my card to a GTX 1060 (6 GB) and from 8 GB of ram to 16GB. I ran the VR test and it said my rig was well in the green! Finally, $570 later I was ready to rock! I launched TGCVR and got a blue background with ground at the bottom, a lighthouse on an island and the sound of waves and birds. No drop-down menus, no left right screen movement with mouse, arrow keys or Quest 2 controllers. It just sits there. Needless to say, I one frustrated person!! Why would you sell a product that doesn't work? How many other games/products does Steam sell that doesn't work? If you meet the software requirements listed on the product, it should work! If it doesn't why are you selling it??? For support they refer you to the TGC-VR posting boards or offer you a refund. Refund? The $10 isn't the issue. The $270 I spent to meet or exceed the published requirements and the frustration of trying to figure out what I was doing wrong... that's the issue! So, should I request a $280 refund? What a HUGE disappointment!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043600729', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1605133430}
review:
I would strongly caution anyone against buying this game. For starters it has been abandoned by the devs, so any issues you've read about or seen in other reviews, are here to stay. The most glaring of which is, and I'm not kidding about this, there is a giant tree in the middle of the practice mode. Not like, out on the course of the driving range, I mean where the player stands. Look it up if you don't believe me (why would you, its absurd). It renders the entire practice mode (driving range, putting practice, etc.) unusable. There is literally (in the original sense), no way to use a major feature of the game.

Lots of other issues, for instance, it really only works on HTC Vive, it doesn't work on Index really at all. As in the game loads and whatnot but you can't get past the tutorial because they are Vive controller specific. Good luck pressing that button that isn't on your controller. 

These and others are well documented issues,. The devs themselves made a post 2 years ago about how they were "working on" removing the tree. I'm not a developer so maybe I don't know but I'm pretty sure of 2 things. 1. Trees don't usually just appear places as a bug. 2. If they did, deleting them would not take over 2 years of working on. 

I regret purchasing this game, and trying for longer than the return window to get it working. My only solace is that I can warn others off of purchasing this. Let me be clear there are TONS of other issues than these, and they will not be fixed as the game is not being worked on.

It's a shame, I really wanted to like this game

author: {'steamid': '76561199081240914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1600282575}
review:
Edit: Now that i have practiced the oculus contollers seem to lose tracking at high swing speeds.

Oculus Quest with virtual desktop and nvidia 2070. Love the no wires streaming via wifi. I thought it was broken at first. Kept teleporting everywhere. After figuring it out I am shocked at the swing physics. How do they know you are trying to cheat and swing hard with just one hand? Doesn't work. You have to swing like you would a real club. Using the blue compass needle to help with your stance is awesome. The haptic feedback when your club is touching ground behind ball is amazing. It is critical floor is correct. If not, you have to reset it. Steam VR and virtual streamer a bit finicky but great overall. Requires 5g wifi and gaming computer needs to be hooked up via ethernet. Better multiplayer would be the biggest improvement. Graphics will just get better on a game like this, but doubt would help the quest. Maybe, I don't know. Pretty good as it is for an over 2 year old game. Looks like you get some new customers. Lucky you guys. Nice work devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018772995', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1598647429}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027269099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1597785710}
review: Nope, not happy with this game at all.  I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong exactly but even moving around in this game is a chore... it would be nice to accomplish even clicking the NEXT button on the tutorial screen without constantly teleporting across the map to a lighthouse.  And hitting the ball?  Forget it.  Not even once in about half an hour, not even just putting the head of the club right behind the ball and trying to tap it.  I don't know if there are any good golf games out there other than putting games (there are some great putting games for the Quest), but this one sure doesn't rank as good in my estimation.  I've never asked to refund a Steam game before, but I'm searching the help guide for how to refund this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011432911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1660123543}
review: exquisitely fun, a huge variety of courses. so much so i still havent been able to find solid links style courses. there's like 5k...fo reals. if you play IRL regularly, good luck after this. guaranteed to screw your swing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796202394', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1597343976}

author: {'steamid': '76561199078631529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1603523856}
review:
実際のゴルフはHC12だが・・　このゲームでは100を切るのが精一杯。ヘッドの重さがないものを正確に振るというのは難しく、ゲームとしてボールをヒットする最も有効な方法は左手を添えず右手1本だけで払い打つことだが、それも虚しい。

　ゲームの特性上、ヘッドの真ん中に当てることのほうがスイングスピードよりも重視されている印象。とくにウッド系は少しでもヘッドアップすると当たらないので大振りはしないこと、ロング・ミドルホールのティーショットは1Wより3アイアンで打つのがスコアメイクにはベター。　アイアンは基本ダウンブローしか認められていない感じで、うっかりナイスショットするとかなりオーバーするので、無難にプレーしたければ確実に刻むしかない。　パッティングは忖度やオッケーなど一切なし、それはそれで良いとしてもマレット派なのでピンパターしか使えないのは不満。　クラブセットもカスタム出来ると良いのにな。

　実際のゴルフではない、ゲームと割り切って遊べばそこそこ楽しめるが・・　あまりやり過ぎると実際のゴルフは下手になると思う、、ほどほどに。

author: {'steamid': '76561197965747376', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1596776588}
review: Controls are pretty weird, you have to grip with trigger, but that's not the big deal. After tutorial, I just couldn't reorient myself. Always had to teleport next to bag to grab a club then teleport to ball. I know my play zone is smaller than required, but needing larger space only to grab a club seems unnecessary. Since you're not actually holding a club and physics isn't carrying its weight to destination, my swing analysis always had such weird paths and ball was very often going off direction because controller moved slightly off course on contact.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190042466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2499, 'last_played': 1634429659}
review:
I've played this game more than anything else in VR. It's simple, effective and pretty close to the real thing. 
It obviously could improve a lot and I hope it does. But for now,  it's a pretty fucking good experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066224401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3910, 'last_played': 1710558771}
review: Best golf game, as VR goes.  Multiplayer ins't the best, but you can party chat and see other's shots.   Tons of courses!  I mean, you can play two new courses every day for years!   Highly recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198004353781', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1599880914}
review: This is the most inconsistent game I've ever tried to play. The amount of effort the devs put into this must have been next to nothing.  It looks great, but that's where the good stops. Don't waste your money.  Find another golf game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166650422', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1595808402}
review: I want to love this game so bad. But since im 7 feet tall its impossible to hit these balls because the clubs feel so short even on the longest setting. I play golf in real life; trying to hit normally in this game is just impossible for me since the clubs are so short. When i bend down to hit the ball they only go like 100 yards. The tracking mechanics in this game are great but its impossible to hit normally especially since your swinging with a controller. I think if the devs could just make thew clubs go to whatever length you prefer the game would be better in my opinion however most people don't have my issue obviously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198962463732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1615752058}
review: Quirky but fun game on the Sunday Course .... using Valve Index. In the Tutorial the range finder / magnification did not function (default bindings) and had to wait for an auto "time out" (10 mins or so) on that tutorial section to allow advance to the next section in order to complete the whole tutorial session. The "Virtual" Simulated Driving Range Booth worked OK but the graphics included an "inappropriate" tree glitch growing inside the driving booth which was somewhat distracting ...  Any chance of adapting the Valve Index selected handset to a more natural "palm pressure grip" to hold the clubs (rather than the rather awkward "trigger hold") ... just a suggestion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039777945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1594579022}
review:
It's full blown golf while using one of the controllers. Let's you transport around, see your ball + swing trajectory, use the controller like a ranger finder, and look at your watch for yardages.

Here's how the first hole went:

1. Smacked it 200 years with a 5 wood into the rough
2. Aimed wrong and hit it into a sand trap
3. Aimed wrong again and hit it down into a pit 
4. Knocked my golf bag over trying to take a club out
5. Golf bag is now on top of my ball
6. Had to smack the golf bag with a golf club until it was out of the way
7. Took a stroke each time my ball moved due to this
8. Game forced me to move onto the next hole due to too many strokes

Would highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198282206487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1551425810}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984794772', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1592161946}
review: A fun VR golf game. I had no issues with it except for the fact that I can't seem to hit the ball more than 20-30 yards...doh! Other people have mentioned having to leave ball set-up to get your club and then having to get back in ball set-up but that's just one button. Whomever wrote that probably wants someone else to play the game for them so they don't have to get off the couch. LOL. Overall a good game: graphics are fine, sound is fine and gameplay is fine. It is a workout though!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996290213', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1591152005}
review:
Close but no cigar. Tried to overcome the issues but it was just impossible. Even with it's age and lack of dev support, this game COULD have still been great, with just a few tweaks. 

Addressing the ball just became way too much of a hassle. Getting spun around in my "guardian zone" trying just to line up my shot became an absolute nightmare. In the end it just wasn't worth the headache, and it's a real shame because this game has so much potential.

Here's hoping 2k21 supports VR. Time will tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009409900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1591050770}
review: I honestly really wanted to like this game, but it was pretty disappointing. Swinging a club while holding VR controllers just does not work or feel intuitive, and you cannot possibly swing properly in this situation. This might be forgivable, but the user interface is just tedious and is lacking basic functionality. For instance, there is no snap turning. There also needs to be an easier way to pick up clubs, as going to your bag, and being screwed if you drop a club or, god forbid, your bag itself, is not fun. The grabbing does not always work and you often drop your clubs, which are then a pain to pick up. I wish I could recommend this game, because I would love a good VR golf simulator, but sadly I cannot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129855518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1592356450}

author: {'steamid': '76561198999253252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1437, 'last_played': 1704400277}
review:
I absolutely love this game. It's nice be able to play golf courses all around the world from the comfort of your own home. This is by far the most accurate golf simulator I've ever played.

Original Vive with wands
GTX 1660 super
i5 9400f

author: {'steamid': '76561197973421111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1615572501}
review:
For it's age, it's still utterly superior to so many other lame golf VR sims. Everything else is cutesy Hot-Shots style. I take it kids love to play online with each other, more party than golf game. 

This is a serious simulation and has a steep learning curve, but it is worth it for the sheer volume of true courses and physics. It's definitely the Plane X of golf games. I have recently purchased a Quest, and it's like night and day when you no longer have the cumbersome cables. I only have one now for the Link and never get tangled.

Some, both novice and golfers, may find the swing system difficult. I don't disagree and as someone who regularly golfs, it feels unfair. (I shouldn't drive better in reality than in VR).

Also, I can't concede a hole if it goes totally downhill and there is the auto club selection does not go in your hand. You still have to reach over and fish it out of the bag. But with that said, until someone creates a true AAA golf game without the greedy coin stuff, this is the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278189058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1629316269}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074174632', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1182, 'last_played': 1639845376}
review: Best Golf VR game I have played hands down! I would like to see a few more updates to make multiplayer easier as it does get a bit tricky to figure out how to play with friends but the game play is amazing and the courses are well done!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019088300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1587758065}
review: If you've got Oculus i'd say forget this, you must need the room sensors for HTC or something. The game has so much promise, loose amazing and has some really nice UI (even a range finder view!) but thats where the good stuff ended for me. Annoyingly you couldn't select a club unless you moved off the ball to the golf back and then back by a point and click teleport. This would get really annoying over time. The most important failure is that with an Oculus the game looses tracking of the club (THE MOST IMPORTANT BIT) and the head ends up impacting the floor by our feet 9 times out of 10. Really hard to make an effective swing with a driver. playing a 400 yard course 30 yards at a time would become very annoying. This really need sorting where for Oculus style controllers you have the option to dumb down the swing mechanics and ignore swing path and just count swing tempo or something. For me it was impossible to consistently hit the ball. So unfortunately requesting a refund... SOOOOOO disappointed, I REALLLLLLLY wanted this to work and deliver as i love the xbox version of this and am missing golf currently. Its just no there for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561199001425506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1587825083}

Edit: Played some more, actually set my VR up in a bigger room with more space, and it's STILL TERRIBLE! One of the worst VR experiences I have had on anything anywhere. REFUNDED!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999570593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1587188627}

author: {'steamid': '76561198354088247', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1658265473}
review: I have an Rtx 2070 super, and this game runs at a consistent 12+ ms. It is very very juddery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173262018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1626322497}
review:
For reference, I am playing on Oculus Quest through Link (Virtual Desktop does NOT work for me) :

This game is sometimes good, most of the time it's alright.  It is as close to playing real golf as you can get in VR. It is not an arcade style game. If you are looking for something similar to the Tiger Woods series where you can shoot -15 every round, this is not your game. I shoot generally worse than what I would in real life. Mainly because some parts are just maddening. 

The ProTee simulator is currently in a tree and unusable. The lack of a driving range. The inability to recenter yourself (plz comment if you know how to do this) and the INCONSISTENT IRON DISTANCES sometimes lead me to quitting before my round is over. - I swear I can hit my 7 iron full strength 160 yards but then it will go 105 when I need to clear a hazard. 

My best round on 18 is an 89 and everything was working smooth (irons were consistent, ball set-up was in the center of my play area, hitting putts, etc) 

Also, like other reviews mention: real multiplayer would SELL VR headsets to the golf community. 

I wish the dev would continue to update and support this game as it truly is an amazing experience if you enjoy golf.  I've found myself chipping on the tutorial green over and over to practice. The short game is by far the most stand-out part of this game when it comes to realism. 

If this game added a recenter feature, and fixed the simulator it's worth 5 stars for what it is, especially based on the development year. I hope that HB studios can bring an updated GCVR to us soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994049547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1586971002}
review:
This was a great game when it came out, but the developer has not updated this game at all and there are several issues that pop up.

Using the Vive wands works great and is a fun experience for the most part.  Attempting to use the Index controllers/knuckles is a total disaster from texture/model mismatching to completely broken controls.  I suppose I could invest 45 minutes remapping every single control myself, but that's quite fiddly and annoying.

Other bugs have lasted for some time and have never been fixed.  Using the ProTee simulator spawns a giant tree inside the tee box making it totally unusable.  There are also no useable driving range or chipping/putting practice areas.  It is very useful to have an area where you can just hit the same shot repeatedly without fiddling with menus or teleporting and that does not happen here.

At launch, I would have rated this 4/5 but in 2020 with no updates and significant usability gaps, I'd have to go with 2/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346031948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1627317837}
review: I score about the same in real life, therefore this golf sim is pretty close to the real thing. Great for keeping up your game when the courses are closed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198424820765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1603146760}
review: WORKS PERFECTLY WITH OCULUS QUEST .. don't know why people are having trouble. Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968329995', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1586827388}
review:
If you have an Oculus Quest, this game will be impossible to play. The Sensors on your head do not see your controller after it moves past them, so it can not track your back swing. Thus, I tried doing the tutorial for 20 min to even hit the ball. 
I set it to beginning difficulty and tried a course. The only way I could hit the ball was to move my head with the controller so that it was always in view. Then I was able to hit the ball. But boy did that make me sick. I had to refund it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976896085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1599793956}
review:
Pretty unplayable on the Rift S.

Also the developer has made their "Golf Club VR 2" game since releasing this.  

This game will likely go unsupported moving forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966956029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1584913977}
review:
I want to state that I am not really a golfer. I took a few lessons over the course of about 2 years and haven't played in over 7 years. I was never super into golf and only played casually with friends.

This seems like a game that was either lead by or created by someone who really loves golf and actually played the game for some time. I honestly don't think you could get closer to an actual sim. There are a lot of little fun details like throwing clubs and hitting your bag with the club that make this game great. There are multiple difficulties that help you if your swing isn't perfect.

Honestly my only problem with the game is the fact it's a bit awkward with a VR controller but that is not the fault of the developer. I've played with the original Vive controllers and the Index controllers. The Vive has longer straighter controllers that work a lot better for it.

Follow the tutorial because you have a lot of tools at your disposal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025192115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1658597155}
review: Great game with a ton of potential. I was slightly surprised at the quality of this game for $10. Sometimes the reset ball view gets a little off, but you can easily manually put yourself back into position. I realize I suck just as much in VR as I do in real life, likely because my swing sucks everywhere. Great game for being quarantined.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997001408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1606064253}
review:
First of all I have an index. This makes it weird to hold one controller with both hands but I made due. It's nice that it gives you some leeway in your swing as I've probably made contact 5% of the time. Not sure what that issue is but at least the ball goes approximately where I want it. It would also be great if there was some attachment to the controller so that you feel some weight like a real club. You seem to always have to push your wrists down in your swing because there is nothing actually swinging.
Others mention it but the driving range is blocked by a tree which is the dumbest thing ever. It's a video game, just delete the tree.
All the added vr functions are incredible. Looking at your watch and pulling out the map are super satisfying things to have. The golf cart is a motion sickness simulator though. 
Good overall but multiplayer would make it 5/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561199016414775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1607978442}
review: Love this game. Graphics aren’t great but they are ok. The gameplay does seem to represent my real life scores so I’m guessing it does track your swing pretty well. I’m not good at golf I average around 110 and I shot a 122 on a course on the game. Which I probably would’ve shot that at that course in real life. The club does completely whiff sometimes on your swings. My guess is if your swing would’ve been a chunk or just not worth registering lol. I do wish it saved your scores and you could get clubs on the game not just the default.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970360365', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1582314528}

You can teleport, but that's no good if you are always forced to face in the same direction! Also, a huge part of the game has not only been abandoned by the developers, but sabotaged by them, It's utterly disgraceful and I found the game to be almost entirely unplayable. Avoid like the plague!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993221685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1581236319}

author: {'steamid': '76561198205640615', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3738, 'last_played': 1671973516}
review:
Update Feb 2022 Game is abandoned. Many inconsistencies have cropped up. I've moved on to Golf+. Far superior in physics and features if not in VR graphics.


I like the game. It's challenging and, because I'm retired, it's something to do on those cold winter days when I have no interest in going outside for exercise. Not to mention that it's a whole lot cheaper than going out for a real round.

There are a couple of pros:
It's beautiful.

The swing mechanics are pretty realistic. Especially after I realized that a major problem I was having was because I wasn't keeping my left elbow straight. After I figured that out the frustration level went way down.

There are a lot of courses available to play so you likely won't get bored quickly.

But, it has a number of cons:
There are inconsistencies with how some of the clubs play. For example I can easily hit a 3 iron 200 yards but I'm lucky if I can get 150 yards out of a 4 iron. And the 3 and 5 woods seem to be reversed.

There is no multi-player so you can't share a round with a friend.

There's a huge bushy tree in the middle of the Pro Tee Simulator. This doesn't detract from the regular game play but a major feature of the game is totally unusable.

It took a long while, using a Rift 2, to figure out that the center of the play area depends on how you draw your Guardian area. I started out with no Guardian area and found that the game would often try to put me in a wall. Also the only way to set your facing direction is in the tutorial area. It cannot be done in any area of the game. The Rift reset view does not work.

Lastly, that game seems to be abandoned by the developer.  That's sad as this game would have an unending future if the dev's so chose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013645809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1651889167}
review:
I've been playing this game for close to 12 hrs now, so I feel like I have experienced it enough to make an educated comment about it. I'll start with the positives and things I enjoyed and then follow this my concerns.
*Disclaimer*
It seems this was designed for the HTC Vive and I have the Rift S, so this may be the biggest reason for my issues 

Positives:
1) PRETTY courses 
- It is a GREAT looking game. The courses and scenery are quite nice in most places. I know it's not completely realistic, but it's realistic enough.

2) LOADS of courses
- Seriously, I haven't counted them all, but there's got to be hundreds of them.

3) A GREAT workout
- Playing this game leaves me feeling like I just played a real round of 18 holes.

Negatives:
1) INCONSISTENCY
- This is one of the MOST INCONSISTENT games I've played. 
- DRIVER: I do play golf on occasions and on average I can drive 250-275 yards but in this game I can barely get over 230? So I tried a little experiment where I did 3 swings with the driver and kept my club speed as close as I could and got a completely different result each time. The first drive when 200 yards, second drive went 50 yards and the last drive went....302 yards? Again, I kept my swing strength as close as I could and the contact for each drive was the same so why such a big differential?

- IRONS: They are either SUPER fat or SUPER long. When your 3 iron goes exactly the same distance as your pitching wedge, there's something wrong. lol

 -PUTTING: Ever wonder what it would be like putting on sheets of glass? Most of the greens are WAY too fast and with just the slightest tab, you'll send your ball across the entire green. Also, the "practice putt" you get before each one doesn't accurately show how the putt is going to travel. There's been multiple times where the actual putt goes a lot farther than the practice putt even after hitting it softer.  

2) CHANGING club settings does NOTHING
- You can change the club length and stiffness but none of these seem to matter. I've noticed that my average swing speeds were in the 80-90 mph range so I changed the shaft stiffness to the one it said was correct and nothing changed.

3) Difficult to aim
- Maybe this is just a personal issue, but it seems like the ball ALWAYS either goes way right or way left of where I'm aiming. When looking at the contact, the face isn't open or closed so I don't know why I'm pulling/pushing the ball. The flight path doesn't even match up to the swing path.

4) The Pro Tee Lighthouse Thing
- This shouldn't even exist. It's a golf simulator so what's the point of having a lighthouse to walk through with nothing inside to do? There is a dinosaur at the top, but no way of reaching it. It seems like this was something they added to practice developing with and forgot to remove. 

Now deciding whether or not to recommend this game is a bit more tricky. Since I don't have the HTC Vive, I don't feel like I can not recommend it because I'm not getting the intended experience from it, but in my personal experience, I can't recommend it. It's fun to play the first couple of swing and after that the frustration sets in. So, I'm not recommending it for now, but if things change, I will easily change my mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370445132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1628202089}
review:
i am running this on a oculus rift s with a gtx1070 hp omen laptop. it runs perfect. changed my settings to the right ones, length of club, etc. you can select beginner all the way up to hardest. you can chose to keep ball in line to help hitting straight or do it the real way. either way, this game is really fun. especially in lockdown. im the only one on the course. lol.

you only need one controller and im not using full room scale. you set everything up in tutorial and it knows the direction you need to hit, so can stay in same position. you use 1 button to teleport where you want and one to teleport to ball. you use trigger to pick club and everything is explained clearly in tutorial for different levels. 

a must have game just to chill out for some golf.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025315672', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1571962099}
review: If you have the Index DO NOT BUY. The mapping is for the VIVE. The first menu shows to interact with the menu, you have to click and hold the right side of the touch pad, while showing the Vive round touch pad. As you know, the Index has a vertical oval touch pad, and does not give an option for re-mapping. Or if it does, I can't get to it because I cannot navigate the menus. I have very little time played, because it's impossible to advance further than the first screen, which is a shame, because this looked like the best VR golf game to be put out so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042888760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1603618666}
review: Takes some time to set up well and tutorial is bit tricky to complete with index controller (esp. zooming to find the right position). But once you set it up it actually works well. Maybe driving range is not working because of the tree (expired license?), but who needs driving range in computer game. The courses work well and there are plenty of them to choose. There are some minor graphics glitches but nothing serious. Obviously swinging with controller is not same as swinging real club, but it does offer quite authentic golf experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254492997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1571501580}
review:
I found a surprising amount of enjoyment in this game so far, considering i have never played real-world golf and absolutely hate watching it. 

I think this game would benefit massively from 2 features:
- Local multiplayer | I have a bunch of golf loving friends who are desperate to come for a round of golf - but the game can't really support any enjoyable local multi-player format right now. 
- Driving range | As a non-golfer it would be great to have a formal driving range outside of the tutorial mode to practice on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796285331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1571229500}
review:
熟悉了介面之後，開始第一場18洞。
僅有幾次下場經驗的我，竟然在家裡找到了下場的真實感。
每次出桿結果都是所有動作的完整呈現，角度、力道、地形都能感受到不同。
非常讓人激賞的作品，而且還便宜，喜歡高爾夫的你趕快入手，揮一桿！

*現在腰還在痠。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561197968879428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1569699830}
review:
Bought this game at 5.99$ (6.89$). I will give it a recommended for the price, but higher than this.... maybe not.

Positive :
+ Courses are beautiful
+ Swing analyser is nice to have
+ Card in back pocket is a nice  feature
+ Fast movement (you can run after your ball :) )
+ Nice choices of courses
+ 4 modes from beginner assist to pro is nice to have

Negative:
+ Lack of user statistics (longest drive, best score, number of putts, etc)
+ No profile, could add profiles for statistics
+ Lack of sounds effect, maybe tournament options against AI, crowd effect on tournaments
+ Couldn't use the screen to practice, a big tree is right in front of the screen
+ Can't adjust the view, only in tutorial, you have to press trigger to adjust where you are going to look, but no option to do it after
+ Could use joystick to adjust position a little, back or side to adjust position on the ball, have to move and getting closer to object in the room and getting close to exit my play area.
+ Couldn't find my bag at some point because I was in some bushes and bag couldn't be found.
+ The position of the ball is setup by default, really need to move around the ball to reset position, I couldn't play my ball properly as I was in my wall because I didn't want to play the ball where it suggested me to play it... I had to try to manually setup where I wanted to be placed and I quit the game as it was too hard to place myself properly.

I'm going to have more hours, but could add more features in the game and it would be fun. Play with a friend would be fun too or getting rooms to play with others... something multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972045742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1569545530}
review:
I just purchased this game. There is a TREE in the middle of the Pro-Tee sim rendering it unusable.

I have the INDEX. I don't think the game has been updated to reflect the index (as you can see during tutorial).

Not only that, but with the driver, I am only able to hit the ball about 50 yards--even when the swing analysis grade is A with 95% ball contact.  I put my index controller on the ground, and it sits perfectly ON the ground, so it's not the ground level setting issue.

I'm pretty disappointed it what would seen to be the most realistic golf sim for VR ;(   Getting ready to request a return.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970978201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1569586777}
review:
