初心者モードなどではアシストされるのでストレスもありません。

ーーーDANGERーーー
VRあるあるですが、狭い部屋でやると手が死にます。
いつの間にか移動してて机に向かってフルスイングしたときには指がどうにかなりそうでした・・・

author: {'steamid': '76561198083609045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1566942556}
review:
at 1.6 hours played I have yet to hit a decent shot on easy in VR. Meant to play with one hand (dumb) if anything you should have to drop a controller and use the second one with both hands. This would make it feel like a REAL golf game, instead of one handed whack a mole. I have tried many different ideas to hit the ball in play and just can'd seem to do it with any consistency like other golf games. I might as well go play a real round at least then I know I deserve it lol.

I know this is supposed to be a sim but the VR version I do NOT RECOMMEND. the  only thing I can successfully do well is put so I guess ill just use it for mini golf only. Shame too cause it does have potential but the VR version is hardly working (in my opinion). 

I9-9900, 32gb ram, 2x-GTX 1080Ti

author: {'steamid': '76561198079199690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1240, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1639120194}
review:
対象機器には入っていませんがWindowsMRでプレイ出来ました。
しかしViveコントローラーの輪っかから覗いて遠くを拡大して見るという機能が正常に働いてない様です。数値は表示されますが映像が出ません。チュートリアル＋1ホールプレイしただけですが他は多分問題なさそうです。ゲームは雰囲気抜群で良い感じですが、ゲーム内からゲームを終了する方法がわからないのが不親切。
※チュートリアルでドライバーを取って何度か素振りをしろという場面から先に進めなくなって困りましたが、ドライバーでボールを打てば次に進めました。素振りって書いてあるから空振りだけしてたのに・・・表現がわかりにくい。「素振り」じゃなく「試し打ち」に変えた方が良いと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197999878764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1559805029}
review: Gameplay and behavior are nothing like the demo videos.  Tons of issues with clipping, putting is out of control, and god forbid you knock over your golf bag.  This game is way more frustrating than real golf.  Plus with no updates for over two years, this game is pretty much abandonware.  Don't bother!

author: {'steamid': '76561198328900952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1633184009}
review:
A good game with a great choice of very nice looking golf courses. I find it quite difficult to hit a decent shot despite being an OK real player. Hopefully I'll get better because it's enjoyable trying to plot your way through the holes.

Be aware though that the developers have completely abandoned the game and even left what looks like two fingers stuck up to either the players or Protee - there's a Protee simulator in the game which looks good apart from the fact there is a tree in the middle of it which makes it unusable. The developers should be called out for abandoning the game in such an abrupt way. A poor way to treat the paying public.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994244681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1582957760}
review:
VRでするゴルフシミュレータ
実際にクラブを握るわけではないのでグリップやスイングに違和感はあるもののVIVEコンが棒状だから少しは振り回しやすい。
スイングがちゃんとしてないとVR内でもちゃんと飛ばないので、こっちでうまくなったら多分リアルゴルフもかなり上手くなると思う。
力加減のインジケータ化はされていないので練習して感覚を掴んで本番で同じスイングを再現する必要がある。リアルスポーツ。
普通の打ちっぱなし練習場が欲しいです……。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970548662', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1621882378}
review: Awesome. One of the best vr games i've played. I suck at golf IRL, turns out i suck at golf in VR too, but its great fun, especially for the price. I found it better than the non-VR version.  only played it a very short time but definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009536283', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1562024199}
review:
THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE VR VERSION OF THE GAME. THE 2D VERSION YOU GET ELSEWHERE IS STILL UPDATED AND IS ACTUALLY FUN!

Now that that is out of the way, lets get to some of the worst issues this game has.

1. Its been completely abandoned by the developers. No updates, no responses, no anything. Dont expect to ever get real support for this game.

2. The height tracking is awful. It doesnt have any settings AT ALL to adjust this stuff, and its all done during initial tutorial. This means that only one player can ever play this game per Steam account that owns it, but it also means that if anything gets off by even a little you must either deal with it (impossible) or delete all your saves and start over.

3. The ProTee option is completely unusable. There is a tree planted in front of you so you cant hit anything. The developers said this would be fixed in an update that never came. Rumor is that this happened due to licensing issues with ProTee, but nothing is confirmed. One more feature you can kiss goodbye if buying now.

4. The club swing tracking is AMAZING when it works. Youll find yourself really feeling like you are there and it even includes some nifty stuff on the hand controls. This is all thrown away the second your height gets thrown off, which WILL happen before you finish a single round of golf. After that, the swing is off by however many inches your height is off and youll never make a good swing again. This was with an Oculus, which only got support later in this games life so that may be attributed to that.

All in all, most features of this game are either broken or intentionally removed and thus makes the game not worth the value. If you just want to hit a few balls on Pebble Beach, then this game is perfect for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059428289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1561687257}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086519002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1696960066}
review:
I've been meaning to buy this game for a long time because I always thought it looked great, but a few of the negative reviews made me hesitate. I finally bought it today and I wish I hadn't waited. It's even better than I expected.

There are a couple of small issues like the broken golf simulator that mysteriously has a tree in the middle of it, but who wants to use a golf simulator and hit a virtual ball into a virtual screen in VR anyway? I also wish I could change which way is forward for me, because I swing left and my PC is on the left side of my PC, so I have the wires wrapped around me which can cause problems if you're trying to get a powerful swing. I hadn't even made it through my first course before almost ripping the cables out of the back of my computer.

A few people seem to be confused and they think all games on Steam are perpetually in Early Access and should be updated monthly. This game was fully released a couple of years ago, and if you don't know the difference between an Early Access game and a fully released game, you may be disappointed that this was "abandoned" as some people have said. But it hasn't. It's just a complete game with a couple of minor issues, but nothing game breaking.

Other than that, it's exactly what you want in a VR golf game. As soon as you finish the tutorial, there's no hand holding. It's just you, your clubs, and the course. It's about as close to swinging a real club as you're going to get in a VR golf game. If there wasn't a heat wave right now and if I wasn't sweating buckets, I could play this for 12 hours straight without getting bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137850458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1561236022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021696700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1558927057}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028903083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1603930801}
review:
I'm glad I kept trying.  When I started, the game took me to a tutorial.   I slowly figured out how to keep proceeding, until I got to a screen that asked me to look at my cyber "watch" -- an in-game tool.   I couldn't figure out how to simply look at it, and so I couldn't keep moving through the tutorial.   I'd "press" (using the Vive wand to shoot a red line, then hit the trigger) on the "Advance" button that showed up in virtual reality.  But nothing would happen.

I became concerned, and then nearly convinced, that the game was broken.  I decided to refund.    But a bit of time passed, and I tried again.   Somehow, I randomly did something to look at my "watch" (I think I just rolled my wrist while holding the wand!), and was suddenly able to see it and then advance.   Finally, I got into the "game" proper, where I could pick from many courses.

So I started to play.   And again met with frustration.    Dropping clubs.   Knocking over the golf bag repeatedly.  Bending down to pick up the dropped clubs.   Oh, I was about to refund again.

But I stuck with it.  And after playing awhile, I managed to get to a settings screen and turn on "sticky clubs."   From that point forward, I slowly figured out how to move -- and how to pick up dropped clubs effortlessly, and all at once, if I knocked over the bag.  Which I continued to do.  

 I found that the best way to "move" is to depress the right side of the wand's track pad, then trigger on the point where I wanted to stand.  After some practice, I learned to move effortlessly to the correct place to stand for each shot.   

And if I knocked over the bag of clubs?  I just depressed the LEFT side of the track pad, and the bag reassembled its compliment of clubs, stood up, and moved close to where the ball was sitting.   Then I did one more small adjustment with the right side of the track pad and trigger, to stand where I wanted.

And after hitting the ball?   Depressed on the LEFT side of the track pad, and automatically moved close to the ball and brought the clubs with.  Then one more right-press and trigger could refine slightly where I was standing, as needed.

I don't know if "sticky clubs" was necessary to make the track-pad work so easily now, but, whatever I did to make this work -- it has ended up working.

Slowly, I've gotten the hang of it.   And at least on my rig -- a Vive runnng from a pretty strong gaming computer -- the actual game play feels, to me, remarkably realistic.    I think I'm no better (or worse) with the game than I am in real life.   And the putting and short game feel controllable, and amenable to practice.

The visuals are not as wonderful as they would be on a monitor -- but for VR I find them perfectly acceptable.  Of course, demands vary with individual taste.

Botton line?  I'm really glad I bought this, and stuck with it through the initial frustrations.    I've got to be careful not to swing and hit furniture in the room -- but that's something I will simply be careful with.  And I can keep learning, and slowly, slowly try to pull my scores down as I play a course over and over, even in the winter.

Computers vary in strength, and not everybody wants to practice a lot of patience -- but I am really happy with this game at the moment on my current computer.   I easily give it two thumbs up.  Some of the complaints about the game -- like knocking over the clubs -- I think I've found a suitable way to deal with that isn't hard or frustrating.   It just took patience and exploration.    Incidentally, I'm running windows 10 on an  8-core (I think) machine with a good graphics card.   I don't have any idea if such a rig is really necessary for the game.   But in my case, it was at least sufficient.  

After some of the negative reviews, I am surprised to find myself writing this positive review.   But I can't do anything else, fairly.  I don't see any easy way to do multi-player, but I don't really care.  Others may feel differently, and I can see why they might.  But, aside from a tutorial that could take a bit more care making sure one doesn't have unintended frustrations, I give this game 5 stars out of 5.  It and X-plane 11 (?) are now my "go to" virtual reality games.   And I suspect they will be for quite some time into the future.  They both seem to me  like reasonably good simulations, and they both take patience to figure out, but ultimately feel rewarding to me.

However, I caution that I am not a good golfer -- I won't be breaking 100 any time soon, either  with this game or in real life.   Since individual skill varies so much, I can only speak to how realistic the game seems to ME -- people of different skill, or perhaps better or worse judgment, might come away with a different opinion.  I'd be interested to know the opinion of this game held by a really good golfer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357219574', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1555800795}
review:
This has the potential to be a terrific game, but it seems that support for it has ended. I was using a Samsung Odyssey HMD+ and while it worked well, it was very Vive-specific.

The sheer number of courses is pretty incredible, but for an amateur it's a little too focused on realism (like always having to get a club out of a bag) and not enough to make the VR experience enjoyable... you have no idea where your ball went (you can't watch it once you've hit it), there's no pin indicator, etc. The ability to aim a shot and lock it in is great, but good luck swinging hard enough to make the ball go as far as you want. Again, great on the realism but without some kind of club-like peripheral it's just an exercise in frustration.

I really wanted to like and explore this game, but the frustrations above plus the end of support made it a refund for me. I really hope they consider bringing it back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044338757', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1596672391}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006395619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 24365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 31, 'playtime_at_review': 11626, 'last_played': 1712421686}
review: Abandoned Game, loads of bugs still in it. Features have been intentionally removed. Misleading Screenshots right here in the store page (game looks nothing like it,unless you have a VR Headset that doesn't exist yet) Its an OK golf game, sadly still the best out there in terms of swing mechanics. Putting is a game of chance and spin doesn't exist in the universe this game resides in. If you really want to play VR golf give it a try and refund if necessary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084043981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1552642766}
review:
買ってよかったこのゲーム…
つまらない思いしてゴルフやめて、VRでゴルフの楽しさを再認識させられた。

ゲーム内の初スコアが156…
思った以上にリアルでストイック。
普通、ゲームならスーパーショットあるんですけど
このゲームにはありません。

インターフェイスでいろいろ思い通りにいかないことも多々あるけど
それを補ってゴルフの楽しさを教えてくれる。
せめて、横のボタンで視点変更できるようにしてもらいたい。

嫌な思いしてゴルフやめたけど
VRなら面倒な奴いないし、好きなだけ練習できる。
引きこもりに拍車がかかる…

author: {'steamid': '76561198005385643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1551471237}
review:
I can't honestly recommend this title.
The swing mechanics and simulation quality amazing but there is something wrong. One essential feature of the game (the driving range simulator) is broken. It looks a lot like this was done with intent. There are many rumours about the cause but I can't confirm any of those.

Most importantly, all questions and complaints about this issue are met with silence and that is just not done. We have no idea if the game is ever going to be fixed. It's just... broken now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966918506', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1641261425}
review:
Dev's if you are listening and you love us. PLEASE for the love of god port the netcode from THC 2D into this... even if you made our characters look like floating clubs that's fine...

First off for any of you who love golf simulators or play in real life and are looking for a good CHEAP swing mechanic and to keep your back and torso limber this fits the bill. The only thing I wish I could see were my feet. This game is beautiful and with so many places to play its a no brainer.

I even sawed down an old club and 3d printed a vive holder to improve my swing . it's a 8.5/10 VR game only thing to make it better is MP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011930003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1549989865}
review:
Simulator swing bay is broken. Unable to use because there is a tree sitting right in the middle. Apparently this has been the case for some time, if the other reviews here are any indication. Because of this, your swing distances and club suggestions have to be made by playing on course, which will take ages longer.

Furthermore, everything that I hit is 50+ yards shorter that what I actually hit using real clubs on a real course in real life. I'm not a great golfer IRL by any means, but I play sub-100 rounds consistently. I shouldn't have to walk the ball 10 strokes on an undulating par 5 in game when I know that a 3 wood would be able to get me greenside if I were on a real course.

Greenside chipping and putting are the only redeeming qualities of this game, and it's a lot of fun here, but it doesn't make up for how broken the mid and long gameplay is.

This is more frustrating than actual golf and I highly recommend that you skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176662191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1664748759}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974353049', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1548953879}
review:
Katastrophe!
Golfsimulator?
Weit gefehlt!!!

Ich habe zwar nur eine Stunde gespielt und habe auch die zweitleichteste Stufe gewählt aber es ist mir schlichtweg nicht möglich den Ball regelmäßig zu treffen! Teilweise bis zu 20 Schwünge bis der Ball sich bewegt. Und dann mal nur 45 Meter mit einem 7er Eisen.

Kurz zum Vergleich:
Im echten Leben bin ich HCP 5 Spieler, habe einige Runden unter Par gespielt und habe eine Driving Distance von circa 230-250 Metern vom Tee.
Dieses "Spiel" ist nicht mehr und nicht weniger als ein "Spiel".
Hat mit Golf aber nur den Namen gemeinsam. Sonst nichts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030930801', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1646521633}
review:
I have nothing but positive feedback regarding this game. I appreciate HB taking it's incredible Golf Club games and making a VR version that truly sets itself apart, not only from other golf games, but other VR games. Most VR games at this point, especially sports games, are small, prototypical, one-off, proof-of-concept games, like that 2 minute drill football game and a few baseball ones that give you three innings or less. this game, on the other hand, is a by comparison, complete and rich with features and game modes and the user-created mods take it to another level.

The swing mechanics are as real as possible, considering players are holding a controller instead of a real, weighted club, and adhere to key components such as club rotation and swing path and contact etc. Striking the ball correctly affects a shot in this game as much as it does in real life and that keeps me coming back.

The courses are beautiful, the experience in enjoyable and the replaybility far exceeds most VR games across the board. I hope HB continues to develop this game and add to it, but it's an incredible game at this point regardless. Worth noting, HB devs have been very responsive and helpful in forums.

FWIW: Game has never crashed on me. Running i7, GTX 1080, 16GB DDR4 RAM

author: {'steamid': '76561198556052174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8852, 'last_played': 1609725624}
review:
This is simply the best golf simulation ever created.

I've played nearly all the non-VR golf games released in the last 20 years. None of them comes close to the experience of this simulation. VR golf has ruined all non-VR golf games for me. There is no going back.

Playing with a Vive wand, two-handed for the required accuracy on the highest difficulty level, provides a very close approximation to real golf. So close, in fact, that I find myself needing to watch real golf instructional videos to improve my virtual swing. When I do hit a bad shot, 9 times out of 10 I can contribute it to what I did wrong and correct it in future swings.

The biggest problem I have with this simulation is that the performance is very course-dependent. While motion smoothing has helped considerably, courses with lots of trees require reduced graphics settings to have playable frame rates.

Also, while the lack of true multiplayer (the game only allows playing against shot-by-shot player-less replays of others' games) hasn't stopped me from playing hundreds of hours, having others out there on the course would be amazing.

If you're at all interested in golf and have a strong video card (I'm playing on a 1080ti), this is a must-buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983105124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1547262511}
review: UPDATED REVIEW: Loads of bugs, and no update to be seen in a very long time. You should probably avoid this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025164032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1679182649}
review:
This game has pretty good graphics, and the idea of playing golf in VR sounds like a lot of fun.

If only I could play through an entire hole without the game crashing, that is.

When it does work, the controls are awkward.  The warp to address feature doesn't put me in the right spot relative to the ball (the ball is about 2 ft behind me and too close to me).  Using a proper swing, I almost never get any kind of reasonable distance, but if I just one-handed swing it will go super-human distances!  :shruggie:

If the get ever gets more stable, and they fix a few of the issues with gameplay, then I'd recommend it.  Right now, though, I can't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020701424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1548646367}
review: Probably the best VR Golf game, does support a sudo-multiplayer mode via playback of your rivals (friends) ball path, just use discord or something to talk to each other. What can I say, just like real life....I suck in VR as much as I do on the real course. game runs smooth on my i7-5820K and gtx 1070. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197977413025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8824, 'last_played': 1619545342}
review:
If golf be the food of love play on.

Friends, Romans, countrymen, lend me your clubs: I come to bury Caesar in a bunker, not to praise him.

Cry “Fore!” and let slip the dogs of war.

What golf ball through yonder window breaks.

Even the bard would enjoy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198867354338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1563278606}
review:
Fun, amazing to play actually, but not great on WMR... specifically lenovo explorer
I'm sure its a great game for the Vive or Oculus, but it is only ok with a WMR headset.  The tracking through the swing will quickly frustrate a real golfer.  
The game just wasn't made for inside-out tracking. 

I've had lots of fun (attempting) to play, but ultimately the frustration of never getting better, and random swing mechanics becomes tiring.  
The putting and chipping are very fun, and I will definitely revisit playing if I ever get a vive or oculus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289061791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 49408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 22, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1712169635}
review:
This is one hell of a game. I almost can't belive how much fun it is at times. To start with, there is Incredible immersion from the moment you see the first menu, almost nothing looks better visually in VR than a golf course. You've got loads of courses, fast undulating greens, etc. Whoever the lead designer is for this game, congratulations. 

However, in my view the game is desperately lacking three things which I believe would make it not simply the best VR golf game, but the best Oculus game, PERIOD:

1. For me, it's just a bit too awkward taking full shots and having to concentrate on getting the clubface to hit the ball, getting the speed right AND the direction of the shot. This makes the whole thing feel more difficult than real golf. There should be a simplified version in one of the easy modes in which a. the direction is first chosen and locked for the shot, b. the club impact positioning is much more forgiveable in that the club hits the ball if the clubhead gets fairly close and c. the main aspect of the shot is then simply concentrating on the strength of the shot. I was actually expecting that with 4 difficulty modes, surely one of them would give you this kind of 'party' setup. As it is, in the easiest mode, you already get that green angle 'ribbon' when lining up the shot, so it's already almost there. 

2. On greens, there should either be a similar 'easy' option in which either the ball gets 'grabbed' by the hole if it goes close, or you can literally make the hole bigger! This may sound ridiculous, but the whole reason I don't play golf for real is that putting is just too difficult on fast, sloping greens, and it just kiils the fun because I don't have hours to spend on a practise putting green.

3, There should be a practise green and practise range in which a given shot can be taken over and over once chosen without having to grab a ball from the bag or do any kind of setup each time.
  
Even in real golf, clubs have been designed with bigger heads, sweet spots and so on, to make things easier and more consistent, so in a game this can be taken to any extreme the designers want.

I feel that the developers are trying to create the ultimate VR golf simulator and have almost succeeded. But, for me, this is first and foremost a game, and for any sports game to be truly addictive it has to make a few compromises away from simulation and towards fun. With some truly 'gamey' options to go with all the sim stuff, everyone would want to play this game, not just golf enthusiasts. It would become the ultimate party game. 

Plus, I notice that many of the issues and requests you've already received relate to sensors, attachments, club length, and so on. With a truly gamey shot selection/taking like I suggest, many of these issues would disappear because people just want to feel they can hit enjoyable shots consistently and they're constantly trying to achieve this in various ways by tweaking stuff and asking you for updates.

Go on. Pleeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeease. This could be better than real golf.

Neil C

author: {'steamid': '76561198061580950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1540352341}

author: {'steamid': '76561198281328328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1580931780}
review: Overall this is a good game if you like golf, I hear the developers have stopped working on this title which is a shame it could do with optimising more to bring it up to now and few bugs worked out like the tree slap bang in the middle of the peftwee simulator, I made a golf club stock which add weight and feels amazing I posted it on oculus subreddit I highly recommend making or getting something like this to add the immersion and to help with tracking as both your hands are not on the controller and it's not so close to your body, and the driving the golc buggy with the oculus touch controller I found impossible to steer, overall its a great play to relax and immerse yourself for hours, also a online mode with avatars and hands would be amazing

author: {'steamid': '76561198815665888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1536032502}
review:
This game, which is what it is, is very bad.   As a simulator, it is really really bad.  
I'm an ok golfer and would not classify any aspect of this game as golf.  It is a walking/interacting 'experience' in what aliens might explain golf to their people after uncovering 100,000 year old artifacts of golf on earth. 

I tried countless things to like this game, but it has so many issues  and just doesnt work correctly.  Swinging is painful and requires one to learn how to play the golf club vr, not golf.   BIG difference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027958330', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1596296295}
review: Overall good VR experience, controls are good and I feel like I was mostly golfing for real. Only minus point i can think now is the zoom ability through vive control hole. It's too low resolution to actually see anything. And some clearly visible indicator to show where hole is located. It is sometimes difficult to locate due low resolution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152412821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1535798377}
review: I played the tutorial only to find even the longest club is too short. I'm 6'5 and when i stand comfortably over theball the club is about a foot too short!! Just requested a refund, which sux caus i really want to play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087419283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1535428933}
review:
No music with little sounds outside of the actual club hitting the ball, makes it very dull. No commentary or supplementary audio. Unless you have a very large play area and are willing to spend a ton of time configuring club length, speed, and etc in the settings I found it very difficult to get an accurate hit.

Unless you live and breathe golf sims, I think you can take a pass on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198810985999', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1605207246}
review:
This game was on my wishlist from the moment I knew about it and I bought it as soon as it was released in my country, which has only one real golf course, a 4hr bus ride away. As expected, it is by far the best golf game imaginable with current VR technology. The tracking implementation allows you to play exactly as you would in reality in terms of stance and swing, although it is worth strapping a heavy stub shaft to the touch controller for a full feeling of grip and club weight.
The only issue I have with the game is that the rendering doesn't seem to have been fully adapted to VR head tracking or to use efficient stereoscopic rendering (rendering both eyes simultaneously using stereoscopic scanline rendering rather than rendering each eye separately), which means that even on hardware well above the minimum requirements for the headset - I'm on a Core i5-8500 3Ghz with GTX 1060 3GB - the graphics settings have to be turned down to avoid severe frame rate drops and double-vision motion "blur". It still looks nice and is fully playable, but unless you have a 1080 or better you won't get shadows or good MSAA.
This is a common problem with games ported directly from desktop to VR - the Truck Simulators for example - so it's not unexpected and I'm not disappointed, I just hope the devs will keep working on the VR version to make it more efficient for the platform.
PS: I only have 2 sensors and have had no issues with tracking my full swing, although if you have a small play area you may have trouble finding a compromise between swing position and sensor position that allows enough space for an unimpeded stance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970684397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1530899924}
review: So they make an aweosme game, but you have to drive the F_ing golf cart around ffs, half the time i have no idea where the ball is.  Driving the cart causes nausea.  So a game that had no motion now gives you motion sickness so you can f_ing drive around.  Can i just teleport to the ball please??!!
developer_response:
Driving the golf cart is completely optional. You can teleport to the ball using the "Teleport to ball" control input (left on the Track pad on Vive or the B button on Oculus) as instructed in the tutorial.

Hopefully that helps you enjoy the game a bit more, and encourages you to remove this negative review.

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963518189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1597899141}
review:
Seriously, did you guys get Prof Scott Galloway to voice the tutorial on this? 

Hi folks, as a kid who's second video game ever played after Doom was MS Golf in 1994, I can say I have a long running affection for accurate bird sound representation, and this game fucking delivers. 

Do you obsess over proper foot spacing distance? Club face rotation angle on your down swing?? 

THIS GAME WILL SHOW YOU YOUR SHOT TRAJECTORY IN REAL TIME.

So for a while I was like "meh ok cool you can actually visit every single tiny golf course locally to me and pay nothing and golf FOREVER", and this was a a 5/5 game...BUT THEN I TELEPORTED INTO THE GOLF CART BY ACCIDENT AND FOUND OUT YOU CAN DRIVE IT?!?~

No mate, you can't just drive the golf cart around shot to shot like you would in real life, IT MOVES THE CLUBS ONTO THE CART FOR YOU. 

YOU CAN THEN TAKE THEM OFF BY HAND, MANUALLY, and even SET THEM UP AT YOUR NEXT SHOT. *the kickstand pins automatically deploy*

I had to go out to the real store and buy a real beer because this shit was starting to get too real. Microsoft should buy you guys out for the next MS Golf release.

**EDIT: So I'm looking up who's making the next Tiger Woods PGA Tour 2020 or whatever, because my copy of '14 is collecting dust on my Wii but the single player campaign was so dope I'm thinking about loading it up just to progress through the FedEx Cup, so I'm looking up who's coming out with the next year's version: 

PGA IS SPONSORING THE GOLF CLUB 2019 AND IT'S REPLACING THE EA / PGA SPONSORSHIP 
http://gph.is/1NE2RcC

review: Tracking on this game is not good at all. When you hit the ball it only goes 50 yards max and your club face is super open.
developer_response:
We do require you to swing a more realistic swing/speed than other golf games, however and pretty average speed swing (70mph) can achieve 200+ yard distances on the beginner difficulty setting. Additionally you may want to adjust your shaft flexibility to offset what sounds like a natural slice. 

Hopefully these tips hope you out! Thanks for playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970558615', 'num_games_owned': 3397, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1658550547}
review:
Great VR golf experience.  It took me a few rounds, and a few changes to the default setup to get it dialed to where it feels and plays great. 

The trailers seem a bit goofy to me, which turned me off of the game at first.  Wish listed, then bought on special.  Very happy that I gave it a chance.  I'm a very average rw golfer, and to me this feels like playing the real thing.   I now look forward to coming home from work and playing a quick 9 to relax.  

At first, I expected a VR golf GAME, but instead it seems the devs have gone for more of a golf SIM.  You can't zoom to an overhead map, or follow your ball through the air,... or expect to chip in 50% of your shots from just off the green.  If you want to see exactly where the fairway is over that hill, then you can either reach into your back pocket for the static hole card, or (as I figured out, after a while) 'walk' (ie. teleport) a take a look for yourself.   Basically your choices are the same as they would be in real life.  

My personal play suggestions:
1. move your bag to where's convenient for you.  It stays where you put it, so within arm's reach, just out of sight when swinging is perfect.
2. turn off the green grid.   soooo, much better without it.  It's VR... read the green for yourself, don't really on flat screen game mechanics.
3. Quickly tap the 'test putt' to give a few extra clues regarding the green, but don't try to make a perfect test.  Hopefully that makes sense.  Otherwise it feels almost like you are getting two changes.
4. After your hit, teleport down the course to watch the ball flight from a better view.  Par 3, then why not quickly switch to view from the green... works great (note: you do need to teleport yourself there, there is no 'green view' button). 
5. Be sure to tweak the putter weight.  It plays much better when your put goes a far/hard as you expect, otherwise it feels like you're trying to learn the game instead of simply playing golf. 
6. Turn off wall chaparone, and only have floor chaparone.  I'm not sure if this is SteamVR or only through Advanced plugin.  Eitherway, floor outline is imporant to you know where you are, but walls can interfere with the experience.  

Really enjoying it, but there is room for improvement:
1. Career mode?  Tournaments?  Right now it very much feels like having access to play golf courses anytime you want... which, while great, could use some 'challenge' elements.
2.  Being able to view your drive distance would be nice.  Not realistic, but nice to have. 
3. The abilty to reset room setup.  Maybe I just haven't found this yet.  Instead of aiming straight into my vr space, it always feels like it's placed me looking 50 yards to the left of where I need to aim.

Amazing, but a bit dry, VR golf.  Really enjoying it, but wishing the game had some challenges instead of me simply trying to beat my own best rounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092431720', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1531006977}
review:
To preface, there is a lot of praise surrounding this game, and I haven't seen many people point out the glaring problems with it. If you're looking for a straightforward, laid back game of golf, you came to the wrong game. I bought this game on sale, but it is nooooot worth $30. if you're looking to try it out, then you should, but be aware you have to refund it before 2 hours of gameplay if you don't like it. 

Controls in the game are a bit difficult to use, tracking is not precise enough to work well with the concept of the game itself. Not to mention the lack of free locomotion and the consistent ability to get you set up where you want to be next to the ball, it makes it frustrating that you have to teleport over to your bag every time you want to switch your club, then readjust your setup again. Far too complicated and limiting for what I was expecting. 

Using the trigger to readjust yourself yielded nothing but more inconsistent movements that made it harder to hit the ball. Moving more like in Eleven Table Tennis would have been much easier to adjust how you wanted to hit the ball. You should be able to pick a club by pointing at it, not going over to the bag every time. I actually would have appreciated NOT having a bag, and just using controls to select a club like any other golf game. 

Yes, as someone who has played a lot of golf IRL, I enjoyed the feel of the swing and the trajectory of the ball, but for something that tried to be a bit more of a simulation, the ball flies incredibly straight whereas I have a slice IRL. 
I can't expect a video game to get it exactly right obviously, but, EVERY hit going perfectly straight wherever you hit it? As a game that is praised as a simulation, I was a bit disappointed by this. NOT the reason I'm not recommending it, though.

All in all, the gameplay itself is good, but the locomotion controls and adjustment for hitting the ball are uninuitive and you can tell they slapped basic locomotion on to an already complete desktop game. The interesting mechanics they put into the game, like tracking your swing and trajectory and analyzing how you hit the ball, is hindered by the horrible controls and general club/ball management. 

"you only played the game for a little bit!", to which you are right. 
It doesn't take long to realize the controls are bad in any game, but it's much more aparent in VR titles. 

Again, the biggest reason I am rating negatively is because of the limiting and annoying movement. My other nitpicks are either issues BECAUSE of the movement, or just a little something I wasn't expecting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267959562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1533265421}
review: As good as it gets for a golf game, but it's nothing like real life. I literally whiff balls in this game and have never done this in real life. It also penalizes you WAY too much for being in the rough...hitting a 5 or 6 iron 50-60 yards max from a bad lie is not fun or realistic. They have a lot of work to do here. I'd give it a 3/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043700345', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1646792772}
review: Just from the little bit I've played (got this during steam summer sale) It's amazing! I'm an avid golfer and pretty decent (18 handicap) Only issue I have and it's not the games fault, but the vive controller as awkward to hold as if you're holding a golf club. I had to make some modifications to the protubeVR that I have. I disconnected a small portion of it and added my controller to one of the slots. I have a pole I can grip now and use like it's a club. Then go into settings and change the offset. Works amazing now. Really immersive and fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961200201', 'num_games_owned': 1238, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1553468838}
review:
I bought The Golf Club on a whim in the Steam Sale. I'm not a big fan of golf, I don't play in real life other than an occasional round of pitch & putt but thought it may be fun to try in VR. I fired it up true to real life, I sucked, but I still ended up playing an entire 18 hole course until 1 in the morning. It's really good!

I can't compare the swing in VR to what it would be in real life (I suck at both so it could be accurate) but it felt decent. The controls are good, easy to move around, and plenty of options to tweak it how you like.

There also seems to be a load of courses which should keep it interesting for a while. I can see me playing this to relax in the evenings, totally recommend it, especially during the sale. 

[i]Note: The game kept crashing for me when I went to swing for the ball in the tutorial. This was fixed when I changed my Steam VR app from beta back to the stable version.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198165475744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1610791773}

author: {'steamid': '76561198296078874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1527952997}
review:
いつの間にかチュートリアルが日本語になっていたのでプレイ、レビュー。
ゴルフシミュレーター…というよりはVRゴルフゲーム。
ボールの前に瞬間移動したり、ショットごとの評価をその場でもらえたり、コントローラーをかざすと望遠レンズになったり…と、VRならではのプレイアビリティの高さが魅力の１つだと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198295440360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1574597493}
review:
If you're interested in golf, and understand the game, then buy this without hesitation, it's awesome! After playing the game for a while, I can only conclude that the negative reviews stating things like 'too complicated, do not buy' etc., are by people who don't have a prior understanding of golf. Also, I totally disagree with the remarks about the controls being too fiddly.
Way better than the Tiger Woods PGA games I used to play, except in this game you can't drive the ball point blank at spectator's heads and watch them drop like sacks of potatoes. Apart from that anyway, The Golf Club VR is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086696107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1530644418}
review: I don't play golf but I've always had a soft spot for computer golf and this feels really neat and like I have some sort of control over the shot. I had tried one of the more arcady games but that felt very hit and miss (mostly miss), whereas here I'm finding that how I hold the club, my stance, have a direct effect on the placement of shots. I still went 20 over par on a 9 hole course, but the game feels consistent and predictable enough that practice should see an improvement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977428849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1676028030}
review: Please fix the training mode! I cant hit the ball with driver, the club goes thru the ball everytime, tried almost hunderd swings and im a golfer. All the rest is good in the game! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198095381707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2478, 'last_played': 1615587207}
review:
This game is simply the best game I have ever played .

Swing works perfect 
Putting is sensational 
Graphics breathtaking 
Amount  of courses limitless . 

I play this game nearly everyday and that’s saying something considering I have a job and a family ,a quick half hour loading up your personal best score and a few online ghosts and away you go .

Learning the clubs  is hard but fair . It’s very similar to real golf as in hard 4 iron or soft 3 , when you get it wrong it’s horrible , when you get it right your buzzing . 

Points I will make to help people get the best out of it .

1- oculus needs 3 sensors and I don’t  care what any one says the tracking on the back swing with 2 kills the shot sometimes . 3 s perfect , changed the game for me from being good to almost perfect . 
2- consistent stance just like real golf you have to hit every shot with the same stance. 
3-pick a course and play it over and over again till you feel you can’t get another stoke out it , why ? Because once you learn the course and have been all over it you start to understand what you want to do and when you pull it off it feels great . 

I will still be playing this game in 5 years time unless they make a new one  it’s that good . 

I don’t own a super pc and on low this game is still great 

i5 7400
16g DDR4 
GTX 1060 3gb
500gb SSD

So the game is in reach of the mere mortals of this world (no idea how people can afford 1080ti) or as I call it the family holiday 

Only Games I play are this , driving games  AC and project cars eleven table tennis and pavlor . 

And this game is outstanding .

review:
Kinda frustrating to play without ability to rotate. Graphics are extremely demanding for some reason, even though they aren't very good. Lowering graphics settings leads to such a jarring experience graphically, that any concentration you could have is lost. IDK,  I'm conflicted. I want to like it, but there are some annoying tracking issues when swinging. I know how to swing a club--damn well in fact, but not here. Nope, I cannot hit a ball with the face of the club no matter what.

I want to like it--I just don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967565965', 'num_games_owned': 1804, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1674616941}
review: This game is so much fun in vr. While I write this I only have 7 hours of playtime as the game takes a few hours to get the hang of the fun has really picked up. I have a windows mixed reality headset and the game works perfectly with it except for the range finder. It would be nice if the developers could add wmr support, but even if they don’t and you have wmr I would highly suggest this game. It offers so many courses as well from realistic ones to user created goofy ones. There is also the ability to drive golf carts and rake sand!! So really you’re not just getting a golf simulator but a sand raking and golf cart simulator as well! Three games in one!!! Seriously though this game is amazing! 9/10 if wmr 10/10 if you’re a vive user!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973804849', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1587310050}
review:
I am currently waiting for 3rd oculus sensor and a spare set of touch controllers... I bought a weighted swing trainer which is about 70cm long with a weighted head which gives a real club feel and also gives "click-click" feedback of the release point on the downswing... I will 3d print an attachment which will fit on the end of the stick and which will hold the touch controller in an accurate position - then realign the grip position in game and I will have an extremely accurate simulator for fraction of the price... the 3d-printer attachment will set me back approx 100eur with a company that will do a complete scan and print + 100eur spare touch extra sensor combo + 150eur swing trainer + game... less than 400 eur for a top notch simulator... (not counting the cost of a 2000eur pc but still a fraction of the price for total immersion).

I already tested the concept and it worked perfectly... down to controlling the fade... get a swing trainer... and invest in a custom attachment! it is a must!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025055968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1487985914}
review:
Okay so this game could be great, but I cant recommend it.

The physics are trying to be to real.  We don't have a real golf club in our hands so the inertia that helps make a smooth steady swing is not there. So prepare for frustration and club throwing.

The way you get your clubs is cool, but a huge pain in the ass. There is golf bag with clubs, that you have to physically go to to get your clubs. And that's fine if your playing in a stadium but most of us have a small space. There needs to be a club menu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391012522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1554001883}
review: I love this game even though it is a bit awkward and glitchy sometimes. I've had massive issues with swing speed and the sensors not picking the club up correctly and just wildly missing the ball which can be really frustrating. i feel like im missing out on heaps of distance because it cant pick up my swing. None of this stops me from playing the game though, if you want as close to a real golf experience in the comfort of your own home then this game is for you! I cant wait for the developers to continue progressing the game and fixing the minor issues. also some sort of 1v1 mode would be awesome, either against a person or computer. LOOOOOOVE it

author: {'steamid': '76561198063942102', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 486, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1585389462}
review:
I expected to refund this in a hurry because I can usually tell right away.  I was concerned about a couple things based on the reviews.  The framerate and the amount of swing power needed.  I'm happy to say that both of these feel pretty good to me.  Sure the game will look better as more powerful GPUs arrive but right now it's perfectly acceptable.
This game looks and feels about like Xplane 11 in VR.  It's a perfect sim with a less perfect performance.

I've played most of the golf games and the only other one that has satisfying physics to me is Tee Time Golf.  The main thing I look for is when you mess up it feels like it's your fault.  This game delivers.
The hit strength feels normal too and is about the same strength I use in Tee Time even though that game will register weaker swings as full power.

The interface and club selection process is polished and feels good (very important).   I like that you can teleport along with your bag right to the ball position very easily.  

 Although I wish the game offered some alternate camera angles and It does lack some of the more game related features such as upgrading your gear I think Golf Club VR currently holds the crown of best feeling VR golf game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073812337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1687830726}
review: I really like playing TGCVR. Running a 1070 and a slightly older CPU, I've run into some frame rate issues and have to have every setting to the lowest (No AA, SS 1.0, Low settings.) Even with those, it hasn't taken away the enjoyment from playing. It is a shame that the game is no longer being supported with updates that would improve it greatly (mainly optimization and real-time / local multiplayer) but this is one of the more relaxing VR games I've played, and I keep wanting to come back for one more round.

author: {'steamid': '76561198381196883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1517694221}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970467950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 8135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3111, 'last_played': 1691248886}
review:
It's not a perfect representation of some of the golf Physics you have in real life. It is, however, a really decent facimile.  The driving, woods and long irons are pretty good. The chipping is pretty good as well. Bunker shots are more like chipping. and I would love to see that developed more. I would also like mulligans for practce on full courses. 
 It is, however, a fun and physical challenge that allows you to get your golf fix in the dead of winter. 

 The VR implementation is great if you have the hardware. I run it on a Rift  (note to oculus owners -set up your play area in Steam VR,  so the game knows where the floor is or you won't hit a dam thing). I use Oculus tray Tool to select pixel density to 2.0 and leave the games ss at 1. I feel it looks much nicer. You might not get away with that unless you have a 1080ti, but if you can it looks gorgeous. For me it's a keeper for sure. You can even swear and throw your clubs -wants not to like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077032448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1512266940}
review:
I wanted to like this game, I really did. Unfortunately, I can't leave a positive reivew. If I could leave an inbetween review, I would probably do that. I love golf games so naturally I wanted a nice one for VR - this just isn't quite it.

Pros:

Excellent simulation - it feels very realistic as far as the mechanics and physics of things go. The putting is totally on point, I loved that part. The golf bag and being able to pull clubs out of it is cool. The range finder is a cool feature. There are a ton of courses. You can change the length of your clubs - I like this feature as it's missing from the other golf game (Everyday Golf VR) that I actually settled on as my go-to golf game instead of this one. Although unfortunately for this game, the other golf game does not suffer from most of the cons below for this game, but also feels very realistic which makes it the clear winner here.

Cons:

It's not very pretty and stays pretty blurry, unlike almost every other VR game I've played. There isn't much difference between the high and low graphics settings, and both seem to run somewhat poorly with dips in framerates. I run an i7-4770k with a GTX 1080 and 16GB RAM, which is enough to run pretty much anything out there right now with fairly high settings and good framerates. The blurry ugly graphics along with framerate drops totally breaks the immersion for me.

There isn't much of a game element - you just play courses. This is fine, but it does leave something to be desired - some goals, some feedback, even some commentary can be fun in a golf game. This game has none of those things. Aside from the initial tutorial, it's just you, the coarse, and some really subpar graphics with bad framerates.

The swing physics seem to be fairly accurate. I don't play real golf much, so I'm not a very good player in real life. However, in real life, I can generally hit a ball much farther than I can in this game, even on the 'casual' setting which supposedly gives you a boost. Seeing the path of your swing after you do it is pretty cool but doesn't make up for the extremely long holes of double and tripple bogies due to not being able to hit the ball as far as you probably should be able to.

You can teleport around, which is  a nice feature, but it's still pretty difficult to line up a different shot other than one that's automatically aimed towards the whole. You almost need a really big play area so you can just walk up to the ball and swing at a different angle - like all the way 360 degrees around it, preferably. My play area is about 2m by 3m or so, and to me it was on the cusp of not being enough. This statement holds true for the other golf game I mentioned earlier too btw - and that one you can't teleport in, but I seem to have less need for it in that game for some reason.

The background ambience is not quite convincing, and it just adds to the game not being immersive in it's other ways.

I requested a refund on this one - it's just not satisfying enough for me to spend hours in golfing. It was cool at first, but it's downfalls got to me very quickly - the biggest being the bad graphics and poor performance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983102831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1603038805}
review:
It's interesting! Been getting back into golf and this is great! The golf cart for the first time will blow your mind if you're standing!

I must agree that the game could use some optimization. I'm on a water & o/c'd 6600k/Rx Vega 56 and am able to run high with SS @ 1.0 and no AA smoothly. This is on the Samsung Odyssey HMD and the windows steamvr preview. I have noticed that my cpu utilization will still stop around 50% in this game which I believe is holding me back (even with yesterday's update). Upping the SS and AA levels helps smooth out distanct foliage and shadows considerably, which unfortunately have a pixelated effect that sparkles and gets annoying. 

Gameplay is good although I find the club reaching outwards on downswing. I also play with senior flex because swinging at my normal speed with something so light as a controller hurts my elbow/bicep. Putting is also finicky but eh it's ok.

Much fun, hope his will get another update or TGC 2 comes out with VR and better multiplayer and optimization.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990203170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1550721316}
review:
While the concept is nice the implementation and tracking is poor. Though it's going to be hard to emulate a golf swing when you are not holding on to a golf club. I play golf 3 times a week and you have to 'game' this system in order for it to register a good swing/impact/or distance. Having to not use your normal golf swing feels awkard and makes it really not a good simulator. 

Something like the OptiShot is a better simulation experience for accuracy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967610818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1508560878}
review:
Game is way too hard. In fact, it is unrealistic in that regard. I am a poor golfer IRL but I usually drive off the tee around 200-250 yds. This game evaluated my driver distance at 92 yds! On a par 5 at slightly over 500 yds, I was still 250 from the hole after 4 shots! I do MUCH better than this on an actual course.  On another hole with water in front of the tee I was UNABLE TO CLEAR THE WATER!  And it makes you get another ball from the bag. LOL!

I like the concept and would consider buying again if the game is 'balanced' a little better. For now, I've requested a refund and am going with something a little less 'sim'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055619479', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1503853871}
review: Zajímavý, fakt zajímavý. Hřiště (a celkově grafika) jsou hnusný jak noc. Jako ty textury... Ale to nejdůležitější se tomu upřít nedá - fakt hrajete golf ve VR! Chodíte po hřišti, šviháte holí, puttujete, čtete green, rozčilujete se, dáváte mocnej drive. Vzhledem k tomu, jak dobře funguje snímání švihu (golfisti - to si fakt musíte zkusit, sice je to divnej pocit nedržet hůl, ale jinak to funguje opravdu věrohodně), pevně věřím, že se jedná o nový směr golfovejch simulátorů a že se již brzy dočkáme některého z následovníků, kdy grafika bude vypadat aspoň jako v PGA od EA a budete mít na výběr nespočet hřišť po celém světě. Bohužel jsem ještě nedohrál ani jednu 18, protože mám většinou po 3 jamkách dost (orientace, zkažený švihy, motion sickness), ale stejně je to prostě mazec...

author: {'steamid': '76561198410794516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1507732222}
review:
かなり硬派なシミュレータ。
ゴルフ未経験かつ方向音痴はかなり苦戦します。
コースにはとくに表示がなく、
グリーンの方向がわからない場合がしばしば。
VRなんだから、HMD表示があっても良かったのでは。
結果は1番ホールダブルボギー。

author: {'steamid': '76561198087974479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1517567019}
review:
While I have not had a lot of time to play The Golf Club VR yet, I fault that on the weather still being nice outside. Once the outdoor activities start to slow down I anticipating putting a lot of time and energy into this game as I get my golfing fix for the winter. 

What this game has going for it?: 
- Almost unlimited number of courses
- Very immersive as you actually feel that you are on the course. 
- You get to drive the golf cart to find your ball

What can be improved:
- Would have loved to see multiplayer, even if just one other player. We get around this by playing the same course at the same time and talking on discord. 
- The controls for the cart, at least for me, are finicky and I haven't gotten the hang of them yet. I spend most of my time driving in circles. 

I am still overall very satisfied with this game and look forward to really getting into the action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093601128', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1619729471}
review:
It is a positive given the game is great to play, runs well and as a golf VR sim the closest I have played as of yet to the real thing.

A few things MASSIVELY let it down;

NO local or online multiplayer
NO career progression or any way to see quickly how you have already performed against a course

Surely the difficult bit wold be creating the main gameplay! PLEASE update :0)

author: {'steamid': '76561198319221590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1565111542}
review:
Probably the only halfway decent golf simulator in VR at the moment.

Having said that, it's not very good at all. Graphics are very poor - the screenshots on the store page must be taken from the 2D version, because it looks NOTHING like that in VR with almost no lighting effects and very basic scenery. And yes, that's on the very highest setting. You'd think with such basic visuals and a static, dead world it would at least run buttery smooth. Wrong again - on a 4.6GHz 6700K, 32GB and a 1080 (x2 if anything in VR ever uses SLI) it judders and stutters like crazy. I'm not even sure why they tease you with MSAA and SS options at this point. 

Then comes the confusing club selection (a 5 wood shoots further than a driver apparently). Talking of drivers, good luck reliably connecting with the ball using that thing. On the plus side, you can at least throw your clubs around in frustration - it simulates that aspect of golf very well. 

If you really must have a golf game in VR, then get this since you have no other choice. Just temper you expectations accordingly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039506974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1504250814}
review:
I can't recommend this game at this point mostly due to the restraint of current VR technology. On my Vive, playing this game is awkward. There are just too many wires on Vive that it is almost impossible to make a good swing. 

The game itself got most of the implementation correct IMO, but there are some critical flaws as well.

1) Where the hell exactly is the yardbook? It should just be integrated into the smart watch. Don't call it smart watch. Turn it into a screen with more info. Put the yardbook in it as well as the scoreboard. I don't want to grab the yardbook from the bag. It is hard to locate. It breaks the immersion and it is just awful.

2) I can never hit a ball well with the Driver. It is super confusing. I guess mostly it is due to the difficulty of implementation visual depth, so I can't tell where the ball is hit.

Overall I think it is a great concept, a great implementation, but with the current hardware, it is just not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350030085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2067, 'last_played': 1534195858}
review:
I love this game.  I've played about 3 rounds of golf in real life, but I love watching the pros on TV, so I bought it.

  My first few rounds, I got so many BZZZ, BZZZ, BZZ and ended up at the next tee, because I maxed out on strokes.  I finally got one in the cup without maxing out!

I play most every day, and have gotten to where I play consistently in the low 120s.  Woo Hoo!  :)

My best round was 109.

I'm getting there...

review: HIDDEN EASTER EGG FOUND - If you go into the training mode where youre teeing off into a screen look around for a bit. You'll be in a light house. Go up the winding stairs until you get to the closed door. You'll have to work your way into the wall to get by it. Aim for the table and transport on top of it. Look at the top of the stairs. author: {'steamid': '76561198072157259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1544970556}
review:
これ、まさにゴルフ場でゴルフしている感じです！
まだまだ細かな改善点があるが、そこを苦にしなければ最高だと思います。

＜良かった点＞
・ゴルフ場でゴルフしている気になれる感覚的には最高峰。

・ゲームっぽくなく、リアルな情報表示を徹底している。

・設定でスイング速度アシストや重さ等細かいところまで調整できる。

・毎回スイング診断も使えてかなり役に立つ。

・コースも多く楽しめる


＜改善点＞
・クラブを選ぶ際のキャディバックは後ろに配置してほしい。毎回少し歩くのが面倒。⇒というか自動でオススメクラブを持つ機能を追加してほしい。


・ショットポディションへのショートカットボタンは微妙にズレているため毎回位置調整が面倒。⇒だんだん部屋のセンター位置からズレていく。


・歓声や演出等がないからさみしい。

・画質が少々粗い・・・綺麗にするとコマ落ちする（＠1070）

・パターが軽過ぎる、調整してもまだ軽い。

・スイング速度はもう少しアシストしてほしい。

・コースマップを直ぐに手元で観れるようにしてほしい。

・打ちっぱなしコース等で、各クラブ毎の力加減を計れる仕組みを作ってほしい

・ヒットした場所によって打音を微妙に変えてほしかった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198170903013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1511673162}
review: Love the game so far! Only wish there was a local multiplayer would be cool to play along side friends in the same room, on the same headset of course.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130063094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1535044134}
review:
You won't get a better golf simulation on computer and to be honest Golf Club VR does feel semi real its a good immersive sports game. The courses are excellent and immersion is good enough that I feel like what I'm doing in game could be similar to a real life experience. My problem is I am terrible at golf but I'm sure this will help me improve my game. I do like this game very much it's one of the best VR  games out at the moment. It won't appeal to you unless you have an interest in sports or golf, I'm not a golf fan but I don't mind watching it and would have a go in real life. If you just want to mess around and have a laugh I would say save your money and go from a non VR golf game.

You will need quite a bit room to play as you'll be swing your VIVE controller around like a proper club.

As someone who has never played full sized 18 hole golf in real life just PC games and smaller scale golf I did expect this game to have an easy mode or a newbie mode but as much as you can set newbie levels for the clubs, courses and swings you still need to be able to play golf in real life to get anywhere near par. I've spent most of my time trying to get onto the green and near to the hole. Once I do I find that the putting is quite easy and responsive. I think in order to improve I will need practice and Youtube advise videos so I am in theory learning to play golf with this game.

Since I've only been on a driving range a few times in my life and mostly played pitch and putt or crazy golf this has been a big steep learning curve.

Golf Club VR is defiantly trying to be a hardcore golf sim and for people with a good level of golfing skill they would do well in this game and most would enjoy it. Of course its no substitute for a real golf course but it's pretty near. As for the new player this game does have options to tweak the game such as changing club length, giving you shot data such as swing angle and telling you which club to use but you'll need to practice to get good at it. My main problem is I just cannot hit the ball hard enough.

Multiplayer is available along with online stats and leaders boards. However there is no way I'm attempting multiplayer until I'm much better. Available from the main menu and online there are hundreds upon hundreds of 9 hole, 18 hole and putting range golf courses. Content wise if you like golf it will satisfy you. I would advise anyone playing to make sure your VIVE sensors are mounted high and a decent distance apart, in a small apartment or flat you may have issues.

PROS
+ Drowning in content and courses
+ Semi real/very good immersion
+ Tutorial is fairly decent
+ Lots of options to tweak controls and golf style

CONS
- Hardcore difficulty
- Optimization....On my GFX 1080 and AMD 8350, 2.0 super-sampling not possible on some courses due to FPS drop
- Not really a con but needs a lot of room in your home to play due to swinging action

****************************************************************
05/07/2017
So I just want to add a little to my review. I wasn't very good and getting frustrated at only being able to hit the ball short distances. So I watched some real golf videos on Youtube, adjusted my swing, changed grip and how changed I use the clubs... BANG! tee off improving much more distance and height and now my shots with the irons much much better. This just goes to show how much of a simulator this game really is that real golf advise improved my game. I am finally getting better and even got a couple of pars today.

It might be good for the devs to include some ingame help or videos for newbies who have never played proper golf before to help them learn the game.

Really enjoying the experience I cannot wait until VR resolutions improve in the future this game runs and looks decent enough but when VR goes HR wow time.
*****************************************************************

author: {'steamid': '76561198063352149', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1498428883}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077253135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1497734044}
review:
Great golf game. Mechanics are good without being too arcade game like. Club haptics and swinging work well. Lots of courses! I am not very good at it but I am improving.

Just wish I had a more poweful graphics card. I keep it on low settings and subsampling at 1 for a smoother performance. Just don't expect it to look like the screen shots or video. It looks fairly blurry and pixelated. But still fun given the limitations of hardware and the Vive's resolution.
