author: {'steamid': '76561197961612938', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1497260394}
review:
Awesome game and very realistic. I know it's realistic because it gave up on me putting and moved me to the next hole just like my friends do in real life. The only way it could be more realistic is if a chick in a beverage cart hovered nearby.

Update: If you run out of clubs to throw across the green you can reach into the bottom pouch and throw the extra balls, as well. Still a great game, I just still suck (although I am getting better). I used to take golf lessons as a kid and now every time I hit the ball and it arcs way to the left I can hear my 1996 golf coach scolding me (yep, arcs to the left here just as in real life).

If you enjoy golf or want to get into golf without paying an insane amount to hit balls at a net, buy this game. Beverage cart not provided, though. But a shot every hole doesn't hurt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972848210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1586485714}
review: Nice game since Touch support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000904515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1642219851}
review:
This game truly captures EVERYTHING the game of golf has to offer! I LOVE golf and if you do too this is a must have for VR. 

PROS:

* The ball tracker. swing tracker and the physics are spot on.
* The sounds and realistic graphics create an ambiance of being on a golf course.
* There are a myriad of settings that a VR golf game should have (i.e. shaft stiffness, club length, putter weight, and even a clubface offset adjuster to square the clubface if you attach the controller to a device)
* You can pickup, throw and hit damn near anything in the game (i.e. tee box blocks, yardage signs, flagsticks, your clubs and even your entire bag). If there are clubs in the bag when you pick it up they will fly out of the bag the way they would if it was real life. 

CONS:
* Hard to swing with the Touch controllers, but that's not the game developers fault. I'm working on adding a club shaft extension to the controller.
* No multiplayer or tournam3ents, but it looks like that will be implemented soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067445313', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1637525843}
review:
A really great VR title! I was comfortable with the controls in no time. I know the physics simulation is dead on because the ball goes exactly where it does in real life when I play golf. When I tee off, the ball goes about 230 yards and lands on the fairway about 65% of the time. Then I proceed to either hit the ball into a bunker... or 50 yards past the hole. Once I finally get the ball on the green, I then putt the ball past the hole... about 3 times. Just like when I play for real!

I have a lot of fun playing this game! It is a must have for anyone who thinks they might be interested. The controls and hitting the ball feel really good! I cannot think of anything I would change to make the game better. Just get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011625119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1674422761}
review: Absolutly the best Vr Gold experiance out there, keep up the amazing work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055586349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1535132892}
review:
If there were only 1 game for Oculus Rift I would have to get ,it is this. A super implementation of golf. The amount of  options, courses, clubs make this a MUST have for any golf gamer. You have a bag full of clubs, scorecards, leaderboard, ability to pick up your bag, golfballs, swing helps, environment, practice, etc. etc. The only limit is the resolution and I have all the settings jacked up as well. Makes it hard to see the pin. Also, I wish it was a 1 button process to get yourself level with the ground as this was a frustrating aspect of having my golfer about 6 inches below the ball. I don't know what to do except try to rejig your VR from the Rift settings.

Leaving those negatives aside what a great VR implementation for golf. Huge thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967459214', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1340, 'last_played': 1705420798}
review:
Original Review

I was a little apprehensive when I bought this but I shouldn't have been as this game (simulator) is very, very impressive. The option to add up to 3 (real life) ghost opponents in takes this to an even greater level as it really feels like you are having a game of golf with friends. I look forward to playing many more hours of golf, all without leaving my home.

Jan 19 Update

Up until August last year I was quite enjoying The Golf Club VR 

Then quite a few of us had an issue with the in-game ProTee simulator, which had a tree problem which prevented use of the simulator. 

The devs promised it would be fixed in late August, 2018. 

In January, 2019 the issue was still there, so I tried to contact the developers using their facebook page https://www.facebook.com/TheGolfClubHB/, as they were ignoring the steam pages, to say there was an issue with a tree in the ProTee sim in Golf Club VR.

I was met with a fairly blunt response to say The Golf Club 2019 (er wrong game) was feature complete and to contact ProTee as they were the support contact. When I pulled them up on their response and corrected them on the game, they apologised, which is fine and said, "we are very proud of the 19 games we have produced and to contact ProTee for support". 

OK!

So I contacted ProTee and they pretty much laughed (in a polite way), which I suspected they would, and said, no, they only support the physical machines.

I have gone back to https://www.facebook.com/TheGolfClubHB/ but I am not holding much hope. They only seem to be interested in blowing their own trumpet and wasting your time by sending you off on a wild goose chase.

Finally, this is one of only two negative reviews I have given as I would generally prefer to try and sort out any issues but when a developer just doesn't want to listen then I feel I have no choice but to revert to this (and avoiding their games in future), which is a shame as I know how hard it is to develop a game and a community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024556664', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1614417575}

I just wish the controller had the same weight as a real golf club then it would be awesome.  Also would love to be able to play online against others and see them take there shot and also with audio chat. 

This is right up there with the most polished games available for the vive. Great work devs i really hope you continue to update and make tweaks to make this the perfect golf simulation. Thumbs up all the way i dont feel like i've been ripped off with this title

author: {'steamid': '76561197972134790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1530334572}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059278462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1560380760}
review:
This is now my go to game and for good reason. I cant help but think about how it demonstrates my exact ineptitude for real life golfing because I rush and swing like a baseball bat. However, it is incredibly well put together. A few bugs and crashes on rare occasion, but nothing wildly game breaking. 

The only issue that I really have is being able to see clearly out at distances. But thats the current state of VR and not a reflection of the game. If I could give one bit of advice to the devs it would be to put a single ray of light eminating from the flag as an option. Its tough to see the flag in vr, even for some shorter holes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970823880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3364, 'last_played': 1650189988}
review:
--see edit below--

Swing - fresh air.
Swing - fresh air.
Swing - fresh air.
Swing - I finally hit the damn ball!
Repeat.

My first few rounds with this game were fine, hardly any air swings but lately I'm having air swings on every other shot even though the haptic feedback of the club hitting the ground occurs right behind the ball. The swing mechanics don't seem very realistic, relying more on swinging with your arms rather than your shoulders and hips. In fact I've swung wildly just using my arms and have hit longer and more accurate shots than when I try to swing normally. Short game shots tend to go much further than real life so you find yourself having to hit the ball unrealistically lightly if you're around the green and are only 30m or less from the hole.
The graphics don't match the screenshots either, screenshots look impressive, good detail and lighting but in the VR environment it's like playing a golf game from the 1990s (even with detail settings maxed out). Kind of feels like false advertising.
It's not a bad game, when it works it feels almost like you're out on the course but it's still too buggy at this stage of development.........a few more courses wouldn't go astray either.
--EDIT--
I didn't give this game the chance it deserved, many of the issues above have been resolved mainly through practice and getting a better feel for the game. Just don't play it in Steam VR Beta with motion smoothing turned on, it messes with the swing tracking. And yes, I found all of the many thousands of courses online including mock ups of St Andrews, Augusta etc. Very impressive collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032487050', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1560720534}

author: {'steamid': '76561198383448343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 554905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1656870509}
review:
Easiest review I've written. The Golf Club VR is outstanding. I've read some critical reviews as to techie-specifics. That's fine; it's appropriate for that community. I just like playing golf. And, after about 20 minutes with tutorial, I was swinging sticks. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ / 5
— ReeKeyGVR

author: {'steamid': '76561197970519663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1488516587}
review: Ok, I'm actually better at gold in real life that in this game, and that's a first but this is still the best VR golf game available and for that you get a thumbs up. It's always a little diffcult to look down at anything with a VR headset unless you strap it extra tight but that's an issue with any game where you need to look down often. Nice looking game, good feel, pretty accurate with the swing mechanics. If you want a VR gold game, this is the one to get for sure. Nice work guys! A+

author: {'steamid': '76561198030754853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1488847100}
review:
I'm a terrible golfer, and The Golf Club VR allows me to reproduce that ineptitude with incredible accuracy in my very own home. The future is a marvelous place.

Actually, what's really nice is being able to see exactly [i]why[/i] I'm a terrible golfer. After every shot, you can review and replay every element of your swing. It's made me aware of things I've been doing wrong for years and simply couldn't perceive out in the real world. On top of that, it's a fun experience with an excellent variety of VR-optimized holes.

I have a couple of caveats, though. First, current-gen VR hardware doesn't have the resolution necessary for a realistic golf game. Unless you've really cranked the graphics settings, you can't even see the pin at a distance, let alone the contours of the green. Second, if you do want to boost the graphics to a reasonable level, you'd better have a heck of a lot of horsepower in your PC. The detailed visuals are lovely to look at, but your graphics card will pay dearly for them.

[b]Also[/b], keep in mind that you spend half the game looking down and that VR headsets aren't liquidproof. In other words, don't play this while sweating. I was playing The Golf Club VR to cool down after an extended, active VR session, and fried my goggles. It's certainly not the fault of this game, but I'm hoping this warning will spare someone else the heartache of a $270.00 repair bill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031429759', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1640988214}
review:
I absolutly hate real golf, but I always like playing golf on video games. Playing it in VR is incredible. I like how you can throw your clubs around. Or the whole bag lol. 

 I have tried real golf along time ago. This feels very realistic. All the intricate deatails you can think of are all there. Great job on this game! This should be the VIVE recommendation list!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970788778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1490039198}
review:
Swing tracking in the the golf simulator room is borked. Every swing - whiff. 

On the courses, chipping seems to work well and the smaller woods and irons are pretty comfortable, but you have to swing *way* harder than in real life.

Over all game is good, graphics, the feel of the courses, all pretty good. 

Found it hard to see the pin on a few - because the resolution on the Vive isn't fantastic for small distant objects. Worth a try if you're an avid golfer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003422939', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1490746354}
review: Now this is a well made VR game. I have a I7 6700k GTX 1080 and 16gb ram, the game runs perfect maxed out. Im using a Oculus rift also. I just my first 18 holes and i suck as much in the game as in real life. Pretty much my exact scores. Game controls fantastic with the oculus touch (i do have 3 camera setup)   I would reccomend this game to anyone interested 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970268932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1489284168}
review: This game is awful.  I can put up with awful graphics.  That's the limitation of gen 1 VR, but gameplay is horrible besides putting.  I'm a scratch golfer and could not for the life of me hit the ball consistently in the game.  Whiff whiff whiff!  There's no depth perception, so it is very difficult to tell how high off the ground the ball is sitting.  The only positive thing I can say about this game is that I did like how it w ould trac your swing in the swing analyzer, so at least you get a rough estimate of the shape of your swing, which can help your real game out a little bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035364625', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1545172730}
review:
I sat on this until Oculus support was released for it, and I can say now that it was well worth the wait.  Having already played many hours in the original game The Golf Club, I knew what to expect - for the most part - but the VR aspect was exciting, particularly as an avid RL golfer myself.

So far, the game hasn't disappointed at all.

[b]TL&DR[/b] - For a quick rundown, the VR game places just like (well, for the most part) the original non-VR TGC.  In addition, the game links up with the main TGC game as well, so all of the courses available in the original TGC you can find, and play, in TGCVR.  The immersion is really good, the gameplay is very good, and it's just all around fun.  What's more, like others have said below, if you play golf IRL, those skills do transfer over - and not just the good skills, but also the bad (I still... STILL... hook the ball off the tee with the driver...).

[b]In-Depth Review[/b] - For those of you who enjoy golf and have a Vive or Oculus, you simply cannot beat this.  To be able to play a round whenever you like without having to leave the house is great (naturally, however, I'd still prefer to be out playing IRL when possible - but this is such a close second).

Graphics - the graphics for the Oculus are really good; I have mine cranked to maximum (2x normal) and it looks really smooth and plays great (I have a rig that can handle that however).

Gameplay - I could get very detailed here, but I'm going to focus instead on the VR mechanics specifically.  The interface is a lot different from the original TGC... there is no "hud," etc.  Most of the menu items are there, you just have to navigate to them differently.  When selecting a course to play, it's not quite as easy to find courses as in the original TGC, mostly because the menu doesn't show a "list" like the original - instead it shows a picture of the course and it's name (which means there's fewer courses in view).  You can search for a course just like normal, but it's a bit clunky as you use an in-game keypad to type your search criteria.  What I've done is simply favorite all the course I play that I like - easy to find them again.

In regard to the standard "hud" information, like distance to the pin, the winds, elevation, etc., that can be found on your "wristwatch."  You simply hold up your wrist a turn it like you're looking at a watch and the data shows up.  In addition, once you've struck a ball, you can hold up your wrist and click the button on the handle of the Touch to see the distance your shot went - it even grades you on your shot (the grade consists of several factors - impact, distance, and the lie once the ball stops).  It will also show you the speed of your swing, which is nice (apparently my swings hover between the 72-78 mph range).

If you hold down the handle button on the Touch while you swing, it will "record" your swing so you can turn and see a graphical indication of how the club head traveled on the takeaway all the way through to impact, and it will show you the angle and location of the club at impact as well.  This is really, really helpful, particularly to newer players.

Picking clubs is actually rather cool.  To pick up a club, you simply teleport to your bag (or walk, if you're play area is big enough), reach into your bag, hold the Touch over the club you want, and click the trigger.  Options exist to allow you to have to hold the trigger to keep the club in your hand, or just press the trigger once to grab it, and later a second time to drop it.  As an amusing afterthought, you can hit the club bag with what ever club you have in your hand to knock it over, spilling your clubs everywhere if you're on a slope.

Taking a shot is just like taking one IRL.  Address the ball, line up and aim, and swing.  The swing mechanics are very touchy, and if you don't swing correctly, you're ball will hook, slice, skip across the grass (if you top the ball), etc. - just like with real golf.

After a shot, you use one of the Touch's buttons (B) to teleport to your ball (your clubs automatically follow you).  You can alternatively use A to teleport where ever you want (literally - you can't teleport into water though).  A note on the greens - again, if you have a play area that is big enough, you can walk completely around your putting area and look closely at the path to the cup... it really helps when putting.

In addition, you can get a bird's eye view of the hole by reaching behind you in-game and grabbing the yardarge booklet, which will show you a top down view of the hole with yardage notations of 100, 150, 200, 250, and 300 yards from the pin.  This is really handy, particularly with holes where the pin is obscured either by trees or a hill in the fairway - unlike TGC, there is no "zoom" feature that allows a flyover of the hole out to the distance of the selected club.

All these mechanics work very good with the Oculus Touch; as I said above, it's a great experience and a lot of fun to play.

[b]Cons[/b] - The only cons are what other's have said - just a couple of which I'll reiterate here, touching specifically upon Oculus and the Oculus Touch.

The first is the setup of your play area.  For me I had to set my default view 90 degrees to the left (my computer is on the right of my desk) because if I didn't the wire that connects the Oculus to the system got in the way every time I swung.  I don't know if this is the cause of my issues or not (in my case, it means one of my sensors is pointing at my right rear instead of in front of me).  But occasionally when I swing the club simply won't strike the ball - or, it'll strike it "off" - for example, occasionally my shots will shoot off about 20 degrees to the left, not with a hook, but straight and clean, as if I was aiming that direction.  To be clear, I don't know if this is a tracking issue or an issue with my setup - so keep that in mind.

However, as another user has said, when using the Protee Simulator to practice your swings, the tracking itself does seem off.  I couldn't even get the driver to make contact with the ball... all the other clubs worked okay though, but still suffered occasionally from the same issue I described above.

For Oculus users specifically, the Touch is a hit / miss when it comes to "gripping the club."  I imagine that Vive users have it better because the Vive controller is longer and it looks like the player can grip it at least somewhat like a club with both hands.  With the Oculus Touch, however, the controller is so small there is no room to grip it with your off-hand.  As a result I end up gripping my right wrist with my left hand (I'm right handed) - which I'm sure contributes some to my off shots.  If there was a controller add-on that could add some length to the Touch for this it would help a lot.

Those things being said though, these are not game changers (unless you take your golf REALLY seriously), and annoyances at best in what is still an excellent, fun game.

Overall, again, for anyone interested in golf that has a Vive or Oculus, you cannot go wrong with The Golf Club VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164540657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1490468025}
review:
I've had a Vive since they began shipping and while the VR experience in general is undoubtedly something new and very unique, it has been very difficult to find games that are not a 30 minute and done experience.

This game hits the balance of fun vs realism nearly perfectly and is so good I am taking the time to write a review for it which is very rare for me to do on any game.

[b]PROS:[/b]
-Overall feel is excellent
-Simple controls that allow you to focus on the round of golf
-club and ball characteristics are way more realistic than I ever thought possible at this early stage of VR.
-FUN!  It is enjoyable like real golf, it is frustrating like real golf and it is replayable.
-Courses are nearly infinite and there are so many good ones from user created that you cannot get bored.
-Sound is exceptional
-Developers care and reply to messages in discussion and reviews to help make the experience better. 

[b]WISHLIST: [/b]
-Of course having something that feels more like a club in your hand would be amazing...the Vive handset is a little to thick to make a normal 2 handed swing so you need to do 1 handed.  With that being said, the devs did a phenomenal job of taking what is available and making it as good as possible.

-commentary could have been fun

-ability to create own courses

-ability to set some targets on the range (distance, bullseyes, etc...)

-ability to change out the 3i and 4i in favor of hybrids

-ability to change the putter style.  The traditional blade has always stunk for me in real life and is true to form here!

Honestly, I can't call anything a true con, just the wishlist above.

[h1]If you are a golfer this is a SLAM DUNK, CLICK BUY RIGHT NOW type of game.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198141494160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1488918992}
review: Dear Developers @HB Studios. First to me: I am a real life Golfer with a Single Hcp of 7.7 in Switzerland and South Africa. I really wanted this Game to work for me but somehow it just didn`t. I am not saying it needs to be a bad Game but I would love to get in Contact with the Developers and work with them on the Game. I am by no means a pro but I would say I grasp the game a fair bit. Maybe I didn`t have the patience for the Game but it is just unnecessarily complicated and the Golf Experience really suffers under it. The Movement in the game is a horror and not even talking about addressing the Ball. I relly want this game to work so if you read this developers please write me a pm :) Switzerland can be very wet and cold so again I would love this game. Or maybe just show me the correct settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962438656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 34659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1634746159}
review:
To say nothing of the stunning visuals and a sense of complete immersion, remarkable even for VR, a disturbing number of the things that happen to me on real courses are uncannily reproduced in this frustrating, challenging, but achingly addictive game. Topping, slicing, shanking, numerous air-hits, followed by that manic, overbalanced clubbing which so often results in one being corkscrewed into the ground. Oh, and let's not forget sand-fly fever, contracted from spending so much time in bunkers. It's all here, your lack of skill, indolent posture and flaky swing, all writ large, validated in code and preserved for posterity in your scorecard hall of shame...

HOWEVER, in other news, what a game! What a bloody-minded, niggardly, haughty, flirty, discourteous fish-wife of a game. Those of you with the same dogged persistence and catalogue of ruined Sunday afternoons behind you will know what I mean. The course is there to be beaten of course, it never dangles too far out of reach, it merely requires a better class of player than you will ever be. But, on the right day, with the right club and sufficiently garish flannels, with that crushed drive soaring, arrow-straight, climbing, climbing, climbing into the azure sky... You are familiar, dear aspirant golfer, with the same trouser-tickle of achievement, the same dopamine hit that rivals any amount of luck at the roulette wheel. And, with the same unfailing regularity, the next spin will be a dud and the house wins. But this time it was different and - who knows? - next time may be different too.

In other words, this is not a golfing simulacrum that permits one to attain, by a nurturing of benevolent algorithms and digital hand-holding, the handicap of your dreams. It *is* of course possible to choose the easy settings and take the shortcut to wish-fulfilment, but if you are one of those people who can do that and still look at yourself in the clubhouse mirror afterwards, by all means go for it. Be aware though that it will be implicitly understood by the rest of the golfing fraternity that you number among those few laughable, Quixotic golfing mountebanks who routinely drop zeros from their scorecards and kick Titleists from the undergrowth with nary a pang of conscience. Enjoy your victory, Pyrrhic as it may be...

For the rest of us, keep the faith and understand the nature of the word 'addiction' in its truest sense, as your correspondent, at this very moment, prepares to slather deep heat on a pulled shoulder and cinch a lumbar support to its tightest setting in order to play another round. Pain is relative, while handicap is absolute. But one thing I know, when stepping up to the tee, full of codeine and misplaced optimism, this time, it's gonna be different...

author: {'steamid': '76561197987133263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1682965441}
review:
If you like golf, here is a VR game that doesn't ever end or get boring. This game lets me play amongst palm trees in March in my Colorado basement in slippers and shirt sleeves. I have no idea if this is going to help my real life golf game, but it is a heck of a lot of fun.

I found the mechanics of the game intuitive and simple to master. I love the swing evaluator, course selection, scenery, sounds and physics of the game. Chipping feels like chipping. The driver is hard to use because drivers are hard to use. I played 36 holes yesterday and am a little stiff this morning like I played 36 holes of golf yesterday. It just FEELS real.

User submitted courses make the course selection awesome and full of rich, diverse places to play, each with their own weather conditions and challenges. I played one round in winter and I was given yellow golf balls for the snow to add to the realism.

Multiplayer might make the game more fun for people who like to play in groups. A golf 'pro' to explain why my swing score was an 'F' on that last swing and of course a 'babe' in a beer cart might add value to the game.

On high resolutions I found it best to restart my PC between 18 hole games to prevent graphics glitches and to ensure smooth gameplay in later games. I also found it best to have a play space where the paddles cannot be masked from the sensors by your body and where you have enough room for a real life, full golf swing.

This gets two big thumbs up from me. I really only stopped playing long enough to type this. I'm going back to the Sunday Morning course (my favorite so far) and get in another round before breakfast.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960466488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1488580954}
review: Dissapointed on the swing tracking. The game has a lot of potential but as of now, it isn't ready. The driver is very difficult for the tracker. No matter my address on the ball, more times than not it swings past the ball....regardless of how far away I address the ball. Something very off on that, the physical limitations of reach didn't make a difference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126256720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1533654487}
review: Love this game! I did throw out my shoulder after an hour or so of straight swinging. A few negatives, like the graphics could be better, and the clubs sometimes fly out of your hands, but overall really fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024239094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1487170269}
review:
I play a bit of golf in my spare time and thought I would purchase this game as a way to still play a round or two when the British weather is not so good, which it is a lot of the time.
What I didn't bank on was that this game so accurately depicts your swing that it can be used as a training aid for the real game. 
My real game isn't the greatest, in fact I cannot use drivers or woods because I always hook or slice the ball quite badly. Using the shot analysis in game, I found that my back swing and transition into the forward swing was much too fast and I was losing the club quite a lot resulting in my hooks and slices.
I slowed down my back swing considerably and BINGO, I was hitting those drivers down the middle of the fairway.
Now, I havn't has a chance to practice the slower backswing on a real golf course yet but when I do I will let you know if it has solved my problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969854886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1489904428}
review:
It's a great experience to be on a golf course and suffer the same aggravations you do while playing golf in the really real world. That's how you know it's got something going for it.

Seeing the trends in your swing is super cool, though...It's not a real club, it still lets you understand what you're doing through visual representation.

Performance can be off at times, but there's options for that. Course selection is huge. This is a great sim.

One thing I would like is a crowd watching with proper reactions, and the competition/tournament, pairs, multiplayer aspect ideal. Other than that, this is pretty effin cool!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998450663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1704862557}
review: I bought this game when it was in early access. It had a pretty bad frame rate drop unless I set it to low. So I stopped playing it for a while. Looks like they've ironed out most of performance issues with the latest update. I would now recommend this to everyone who loves a good golf game. My 1070 now runs it pretty smooth. A few graphical hiccups, but not bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214073295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1489152634}
review:
日本語サポートされてないって書いてあるけど日本語じゃないところがほとんど見当たらないくらい日本語表示されてますw
チュートリアルやって、1コース18ホール回りました。
クラブを振るときのフォン！って感じの風切り音と手に伝わる振動がリアルで、ボールにヒットした時のカッキーン！っていう感触がとても良い感じです。
コースを回るときは、ワープ移動です。コースのかなり遠くまで行けて、崖の上や家の屋根等どこでも行けますｗどんなに遠くまで行っても、ボールのところに行くボタンで、ゴルフバッグごと一緒に戻れます。
VIVEコンの穴を覗くと、２X、４Xで双眼鏡？が出て距離が測れるようですが、使い方がよくわかりませんでした。が、クラブは残りの距離や、バンカー、グリーン等、状況に応じてお勧めのを教えてくれるので、ゴルフ初心者な私は、それを手に取るだけでゲームを進められました。
グラフィックはゲーム内設定を上げるととてもきれいですが、私のマシン（i7 3930とGTX980SLI）では、中間よりちょっと上くらいじゃないと重くて画面がちらつきました。それでも十分きれいですが。ちなみに最低だと影が表示されないようです。
VIVEコンの表示ですがプレイ中にグラフィックが消えてしまいます。不具合かな？VIVEコンのボタン表示だけが残っているので、そのまま18ホールプレイはできましたが。不具合ならすぐ気が付いて直してるだろうから、私のPCの相性かな？
最後に、コースにあるカートの運転席に入ると赤いスイッチがあって押せるんだけど、あのカートは動くのだろうか？(´゜д゜｀)

author: {'steamid': '76561198038245947', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1558, 'last_played': 1699635743}
review:
I don't normally write reviews. But, had to for this. If (like me) you feel like you are lacking long lasting experiences in VR, get this! It will help if you enjoy Golf of course. If you've played IRL, skills actually transfer. But, it really needs a golf grip/vive tracker controller as the standard controllers are obviously the wrong shape and induce club head control issue simply because you can't get your hands where you would normally. But, it doesn't take long to adapt your grip to work around this.

I've had this from Early Access, and found myself playing this for several hours each time I loaded it up.

And now, with full release, performance issues are not a problem any more (note I'm on a GXT1080 and run steamvr at 2.0 ss, with in game detail at high), swing tracking is definitely better as well.

Minor suggestion/gripe:
Although I haven't fully inspected the full release, so this may be in there, I would like to be able to choose a ball type to "tune" backspin. At one point during the early access changes, backspin was too pronounced and a real pain to keep the ball on the green as it would accelrate back off the surface everytime. Now, I don't seem to be able to induce any backspin at all.

You will get your £23 worth out of this if you enjoy golf.

Obviously, ensure you have space to make swings, you will hit things in your room hard if you do not and USE THE WRIST STRAP!

EDIT TO ADD:
i7 4790K 4.4ghz
16GB Ram
ASUS GTX 1080 STRIX OC

author: {'steamid': '76561197962466528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 3142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1543, 'last_played': 1632605397}
review: GOLFVR just left beta and I have to say its pretty amazing. I played live with a friend from Ottawa yesterday 18 holes for 2 hours, Shot a 105! it felt like I was playing on a real course, all I needed was a beer in my hand to sip every 5 shots. GOLFVR has over 130,000 courses and a few from Manitoba too. For $32CAN buckaroos, its an amazing achievement. I am going to open up my VR studio next week to anyone here in Winnipeg who wants to come by and check it out for free. Golfing has never been so much fun! 10/10 Golf Balls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011324831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1538152976}
review: With the latest release of The Golf Club VR I am now ready to give it a 100% endorsement. The game is a blast, with fun courses and "realistic" game play. Putting is tricky, but I expect to improve with time. Tee to green play is now free of bugs as far as I can tell, with shots recreating what you do with the "club". The game has been optimized so that now if you have a killer system you can run everything at max and have a stutter-free experience. Highly Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315103359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1709960075}
review:
It's very good golf vr game. I recommend to make grip accesoriy for oculus users.
One hand grip is not suitable to feel real game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998478588', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1493325692}
review: Great game but would be so much better with local multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156828002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 4573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3950, 'last_played': 1703957825}
review: A must have experience for serious PCVR

author: {'steamid': '76561198005426643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1574383972}
review: By far the best VR game I've played. Hopefully it translates well to my actual golf game...agh it will probably still be crap. It doesn't matter though I'm having to much fun standing in the middle of my living room swearing and thinking I should be better than I actually am. My only gripes are being tethered to my pc (general gripe), the floor level changing when a course loads, and the pins are hard to see. Using the Oculus.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979537937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1488007996}
review: So great! I have been waiting for Oculus support for the longest time and it is excellent. Please give us true live multiplayer support!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128756470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1523170367}
review:
このゴルフゲームは凄い！
実際にコース回ってゴルフしてる感じが凄くします。
自分はこのゲームがきっかけで本物のゴルフを始めました。
プレイレベルが自分で決められるのでゴルフやったことない人でも全然楽しめます。
ゴルフだけじゃなく景色も好きなように見に行けます。
家の屋根や山の頂上から見る景色はとてもいいです。
現在練習場など追加され、より一層楽しめる仕様になってきています。
プレイ設定も色々追加されてとてもやりやすくなっています。
あと日本語対応と記されていませんが、ほぼ日本語で書かれています。
チュートリアルや設定の項目、コントローラーのボタン表示などは全て日本語です。
英語は音声ぐらいで他はほぼ日本語です。

author: {'steamid': '76561197969984517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1542860657}
review:
Wow, I hadn't played this game since I purchased it a few months ago and coming back to it I am amazed at how much they've improved this game.

This definitely feels like a triple A game. The game play, graphics, and overall feel of this game is top-notch. I would have paid $40 and still been happy.

The only thing I would really like to see is a local player-versus-player option. Hopefully set up like Cloudlands where each player can finish the hole before switching the headset.

Just teleporting around the landscape is tons of fun. They could probably build an RPG or FPS using the environment and it would be incredible.

The physics and UI are also done very top notch. I'm not a golfer so setting it to easy mode is just like a premium arcade golf simulator. Setting it to a higher difficulty makes it much more realistic though. 

Anyway, if you are into VR and have a Vive, (not sure how well touch works with it), you owe it to yourself to pick up this game. You will not be disappointed.

Oh, and it definitely takes advantage of high end systems and is very demanding. Even my 1080 will only run it on medium quality and 1.3 SS but it still looks beautiful at those settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245031100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1503761348}
review: If you like golf, buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969909816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1609810801}
review:
First few hours playing I found the game to be inconsistent with swing speed and putting.  Adjusting the visual settings to medium with 1.3 SS and using the latest beta release the swing speed has been much more relialbe and therefore a lot easier in selecting the right club.  I'm also better at putting, but this is probably due to getting used to the speed and swing mechanic of putting.  The game could definitely use a practice green though.  Well worth the $25 so far and the devs continue to make improvements.

i7 5820k
EVGA 1070 FTW
16 GB RAM
HTC Vive

author: {'steamid': '76561198361907926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1710181309}
review:
Remember this is a golf simulator. If you want an arcade friendly golf game, buy a golf game on console. If you want to feel a golf club and hit a ball into a screen, go to a sports bar. If you are nit picking the overall golf experience, go play the real thing.

That being said....this game is amazing. I am a long time golf and video game patron and this is a great blend of both. I constantly remind myself that this is virtual reality and this is an early access game. So I'm not expecting all the bells and whistles, but am confident that when the developers fine tune everything needed...this will be the greatest golf simulation ever. 

So if you have the computer specs and the Vive, this better be one of the first things purchased. If it isn't, then you're not a fan of golf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358537722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1575527237}
review: I like the game and the courses are great, but..................what bugs me most is that I cant see the hole that is front of me....meaning that when I hit a shot, I'm not sure where the green is.   This game needs to have an option to show an overhead view of the hole you are playing anytime you want to see it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247100116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1698, 'last_played': 1514250737}
review:
First review I have ever written because it is much deserved. 

This game is hands down the best VR game I have played, with Audioshield currently in second. If you are a golf fan like I am, you would absolutely love this and play it for hours and hours. I will admit, I struggled at first to make solid contact with the ball (as have my friends that have played), but once you get the hang of it you will find that you cannot stop playing.

The big con on here, however, is green speeds. The greens are just insanely fast on this game for some reason. Approach shots, chipping, and putting can be very frustrating. A perfect approach shot that lands on the front of the green will manage to roll all the way off the back end of the green. The difference in speed from the fringe and green is also unbalanced. Normally, putting from the fringe is the common route in real life. However, I've found that chipping with a loft wedge from the fringe (which most would never do in real life) is the best way to go in this. 

With that said though, those are the only cons I've experienced in this game. The developers are great on updating the game and improving it. So hopefully green speeds (which I can't imagine being difficult to change) will be reduced at some point. 

I definitely would recommend this game to VR players, especially golf fans!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083829944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1532290862}
review:
How well can a golf game be simulated in VR?  That was my primary concern when I was researching this game.  I had played Cloudland Mini Golf and found that at least when it comes to putting the use of the Vive controller is sufficiently convincing.  But how would that translate to a full golf swing without the use of a full club?  As it turns out quite well.  Granted the feel of the weight of the club isn't there but the mechanics of the swing are still the same.
  It's extremely enjoyable to be able to play a round of golf without needing to leave my house and without the annoyance of searching for my ball every time it leaves the fairway.  This is especially useful during an Ohio winter when the cold makes golfing outside a bit miserable.
  I'm very excited to see how the upcoming Vive Tracker adds to this experience.  Using an actual club will certainly enhance the experience.
  The only problem I've run into so far is when I hit the ball off a cliff on the insanely challenging Pacific Jewel course.  The drop zone ended up being the side of a nearly vertical cliff face.  This left me in a bit of a dilemma as no matter where I dropped the ball it would simply fall into the water.  Without being able to figure out any other options I eventually had to abandon that game.  Perhaps a "skip current hole" option could be put in place for unpredictable occurrences such as that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982880626', 'num_games_owned': 2021, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1639190790}
review: Would be the ultimate VR Golf experience if it had Multiplayer. Shoot an 18 hole course with your friends is all this is missing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992732525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1491751700}
review: My farther-in-law is a private golf instructor and builds customized club sets for clients. I'm not a fan of golf but I bought "The Golf Club VR" because I wanted him to experience VR. After a few hours of game play, I took over to play it too.  He used the in game analysis to correct my swing and teach me about golf strategies v.s. different terrain and wind. Because of this, my swing posture and accuracy is 100x better. I also know a lot more about golf because of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005012719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1482193936}
review:
There is one major flaw with playing this great golf sim in VR  -  It's the fact that when playing golf you spend a lot of time looking straight  down at  the ground at you ball, and a VR headset starts to get very heavy  and   begins to strain your neck. It also needs  to be pretty tight on your head to stop it slipping or falling away from your face. This for me was a major factor( more than any other VR game) in me refunding an otherwise excellent Golf Sim. It's overall  juse too uncomfortable to play with the current generation of VR Headsets (Vive in my case). I think once  VR headsets lose a bit more wieght,  loose the trailing wire and become wireless then a Golf Sim will become infinitely more playable.

Well done to the Devs a great Golf game in the making.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039403397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1487588689}
review:
游戏具有超高的还原度，除了手柄的握感和球杆有区别以外，几乎和现实没多少区别了。
——说到手柄的握感，未来说不定会有专门的外设，不过重量什么的和真杆也肯定有很大差别。毕竟室内挥杆还是挺危险的。
系统操作的引导很细致，每个细节都照顾到位了。而且增加了很多辅助功能，比如手伸向球杆，会出现一个虚拟屏幕来提示球杆信息。转动手腕可以看到一个智能手表提示风速和距离。最赞的是有挥杆轨迹分析和对比，包括击球点的分析等，这个是现实里很难享受到的了。
可能唯一的不足就是对高尔夫本身并没有太多的指导。对于完全零基础的新人来说可能会比较困难。
当然游戏也提供了纯属娱乐的初学者模式，系统会给出预判的飞行轨迹和落点，锁定以后只需要挥杆就可以百分百落到预判的位置。为了体验高尔夫本身的玩家肯定不会选择这个模式，但是对于不会打的玩家还是挺有娱乐性的。（我自己还没玩过这个模式，只是看说明是这个意思）
话说回来，要想在这么高还原度的模拟游戏里保证精确性，还是要求玩家本身经过教练的现场训练才可以。光靠游戏里的引导要想把动作做到位我看不太现实。所以干脆直接跳过了高尔夫本身的指导部分，也就还是可以理解了。
游戏风景做得不错，因为脱离了现实的束缚，很多场景可以做到很有想象力。比如一个人在大海中的一座孤岛上打球，洞在几百码外的另一个孤岛上什么的。时不时还会有巨型鲸鱼来到海面。现实里要玩儿这个场地怕是困难多多。
总得来说很有诚意的游戏，是目前玩过的最好的高尔夫模拟。推荐有一定基础的玩家入手。
BTW，用习惯的握球杆的方式握手柄真的很痛苦，因为还得按住扳机保证球杆不掉。但要是不用习惯的握法挥杆的时候又觉得别扭。希望这个点可以修改一下，做到拿起球杆后可以自动锁定什么的，要不按扳机真的累。

author: {'steamid': '76561197973857703', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1485697637}
review: le jeu ne se lance pas malgré une config gamer tres bonne

author: {'steamid': '76561198061923526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1485646352}
review: While the game can be something great, the graphics right now are terrible. I'll see what the future holds for this but had to request a refund as in it's current state, it's not worhty of even early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961629855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1654368780}
review: Outstanding use of VR, very impressive amount of work went into the controls.  By far the most robust and detail oriented tutorial that in the little bit of time I have played thus far I can tell this one is a must buy for anyone with access to a Vive regardless of you being a golf lover or not.  A wide variety of courses including putt putt only courses which to my surprise I wasn't even aware was in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075345642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1539195408}
review: Golf Club VR now supports Oculus Rift and work really well. Much appreciate the devs working Rift support into their title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965486475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1539163293}
review: This game is really a lot of fun once you get used to swinging.  I am hoping for better Oculus Touch button implementation in a future update (please).  Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079603837', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1484724117}
review: It's a great, realistic, and relaxing game. I'm about as bad in this game as I am in real life, so I think that attests to the realism. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967450014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1484425706}
review: Une vrai simulation de Golf ! Oubliez toutes les autres simulations auxquelles vous avez joué, vous avez enfin trouvé la pépite ! Impeccablement réalisé au niveau du swing, vous pouvez savoir lorsque votre club touche la terre pour bien vous positionné lorsque vous sentez la vibration dans la manette. Concu pour pouvoir être 100% géré avec un seul controlleur afin de bien pouvoir utiliser celui-ci comme un club, et faire vos swing sans être gêné par un deuxième controlleur en main. Des tonnes de parcours impeccablements modélisés, un bruit de frappe hyper réaliste, un bonheur. A ce jour, le seul problème reste l'optimisation graphique. Un aliasing très gênant pour distinguer le drapeau au loin qui ne peut être limité qu'en augmentant au max les paramètres graphiques concernés qui font tomber complètement la fluidité du jeux...(GTX 1080, 8 go de ram et proc I5-4570 à 3,20Mghz en 2 coeurs). Alors oui, vous n'aurez pas un swing avec une manette de quelques grammes sur laquelle le positionnement des mains est un peu compliqué par rapport à un club mais les sensations sont là. Avec un peu d'imagination la sensation est là....Allez, une petite optimisation graphique, un multi-joueurs où on peut se voir et regarder l'autre faire son swing et on aura une pépite !

author: {'steamid': '76561197970500249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1542940145}
review: Good first attempt at a virtual golf game, but I can't recommend this yet for all your avid golfers out there looking for a decent VR golf experience. For one, the graphical performance is not very optimized yet. Low frame rates hurt the experience a bit (Latest i7 cpu, NVIDIA 1070 GPU). Second, the vive controller is simply not a golf club.. Hitting a ball well in this VR game means you won't use your normal swing, which means it will hurt your real golf game if you play it alot. Until they come out with a good controller that properly simulates a real golf club, I would stay away from this VR golf sims (or any other)

author: {'steamid': '76561198134570431', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1645433746}
review:
J'étais sûr qu'on pourrait faire un truc bien en golf avec un casque VR. Mais il fallait un éditeur sérieux. Franchement ce jeu est une réussite. Je ne joue pas en réel donc peut être que les vrais joueurs trouveront à redire mais pour moi, déjà, je le trouve complet. Distances, aide ou pas, vent, décors corrects (limités par le vive, mais déjà pas mal) , type de club avec distances, le placement et la façon de frapper ont une réelle incidence, le vent aussi, les coups sont analysés, "notés", on peut étudier le coup qu'on vient à peine de jouer. Je ne vois pas grand chose à redire. Il y a suffisamment de réalisme pour être obligé de prendre son temps à chaque coup mais assez d'aides pour ne pas être complètement dégoûté dès le départ. Après, la physique des swings, de la balle, etc... sont peut-être pas très en accord avec le vrai golf (je ne peux juger), mais pour un non initié, çà marche, on aime. Ensuite on pourra améliorer probablement aussi les décors ? 
Je ne sais pas si des grosses boîtes du genre EArts feront un golf VR et s'ils feront mieux mais je ne regrette pas du tout d'avoir payé pour The golf club. vraiment bien ! On s'y croirait. Il manque juste un peu de vent réel et une température rélle ...!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969372252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1602945136}
review:
I highly recommend this. 

This is an accomplished golf game that plays well with great mechanics. Also, the way that all of your controls are on a single Vive controller needs to be applauded. 

Solid, enjoyable and great value for money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046735073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1485032834}
review: Hay-mazing. Totaly loved this game, my vive is dripping but it was worth it, very realistic and easy to get the hang of. My only gripe is the lack of online multiplayer, add that and bump this up to aaa price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353480396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1497822645}
review: Great game for the HTC Vive!  It's not exactly like real golf, but more so than any other golf game I have played.  Everything I need to do to hit a good shot in real life, helps me hit a good shot in this game.  Like being smooth transitioning from backswing to downswing, clearing the hips, keeping the head steady, swinging from inside out, etc, etc.  Love this game!  I haven't broke 100 yet, but I did get my first birdie today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007378358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1652968623}
review:
I am loving this game on the oculus cv1 with touch.
Persevere with learning the control mappings and you will find it very playable.
Of course proper touch mappings would be a welcome addition but for now it's still really good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994626497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1577231099}
review:
This is exactly what I want from a VR game.

It's accurate, it's fun, and it's very realistic.

I'm having a ton of fun with the courses, and the feeling I get when I hit a birdie is phenomenal.

Well worth the time spent getting used to hitting the ball as if I was really golfing, but once I got my form down, I significantly improved my score. Couldn't be happier with this purchase, WELL worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041226378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4841, 'last_played': 1489531172}
review:
I had a lot of fun with this game in early access, and hoped for improvement.  unfortunately...

In the most recent version of the game, I frequently get a studder on my club animation while swinging which radically effects the resulting shot - most noticable on finesse chips and putts that will be (again radically) short or long.  With my competative mind set, I feel cheated every time this happens, and makes it very difficult to finish rounds without quitting the game in disgust.  Worth noting I've tried some changes with my VR setup for better results, nothing yet.  Other VR games are running flawlessly.

edit: In earlier versions of the game I occasionally ran into this performance issue, but now it happens multiple times per round.  The effect on putts and chips makes this game umplayable for me.

Golf Grades (again - my experience - it seems like different people really have different experiences with the motion tracking and club success in this game).

Driver:  F- , Yes, F minus - Driver to me is one of the easiest shots in golf (real golf).  not THE easiest, but one of.  It is a single repeatable swing, with a huge faced club, on a ball teed way up.  For the life of my, I can't hit driver in this game.  Half the time I see the club head go right through the ball, the other half I get wildly inconsistent results.  It is a worthless club to me in this game.  I use 3I as my driving club.  How in the world can 3i be so easy to hit off the tee an driver is not?

Fairway Woods:  F   I can hit these just slightly better than driver, and so?  though I've tried, and tried, and tried... again, not useful clubs for me to use.

Irons:  C   For me, a full swing iron can end up 30 yards short, 20 yards long, sometimes correct... but I have no idea why shots are ending up where they do after 100's (probably 1000's) of swings.

Chipping:  D   Ultimatly I ask, does this game provide the finesse around the green with wedges that the pros play with?  The answer is a resounding: NO!  Not even close - and the greens in this game require incredible finesse in order to score.  Chipping (in this game) has this kind of robotic land and predictable release that is unnatural.  Combine this with percentage ranges based on bad lies (like a 60-80% contact in deep rough)?  The result of a chip may have very little to do with your skill, and more to do with a lucky (or unlucky) contact%, and an unnatural rollout.  Can a good chip be hit?  Yes, especially with a good lie - and with the short roll out you always have a chance for a chip to roll in the hole (if your on the correct line).  But I would Way rather have more control of spin options, so that with practice I could roll out, stop the ball, or backspin.  This is the type of control needed to score on some of the very challenging greens in this game.  Chipping has been further harmed (for me) with occasional chips that go way further or way shorter than expected.

Putting:  A, when it works.   Occasional random results can have a short putt getting bashed through the hole and 10+ feet on your next putt...  this type of result in a golf game is beyond frustrating - its a game killer.  I feel the hole edge is a bit unforgiving (you really have to get a lot of the hole, and at correct speed to make putts), and putting certain hole locations on fast greens can be unfair (3 and 4 putts with good attepts is not uncommon). 

Video Game Grades
Graphics  C  - while it is impressive how the entire golf course is there in real time, the actual visuals are average.
Sound C  - I feel sound could have been a real benefit to this game in terms of building the environment and letting the player know about wind/ wind direction.  Sound is very average, and really adds very little to the overall presentation beyond the necessary swing noises and such.
Control  D  -   I'm running into a lot of issues, and have to mark this down accordingly.
Fun Factor  F  - Until I can play a clean game with consistency - playing this game is more a test of patience than fun.

edit:  my review has done a 180 since early access - because it plays a worse game of golf than it did in earlier versions.  Clubs like driver and fairway woods did not improve in how they are balanced.  My consistency with irons, wedges and putter have gotten worse with extended play.  This is not a ringing endorcement for a game where you  want the ability to find a groove and have fun playing golf.  This final version for me is a disappointment

author: {'steamid': '76561197984813729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2413, 'last_played': 1514711823}
review:
I have the PS4 version of The Golf Club so when I saw there was a VR version it was a no-brainer. It's a bit fiddly with the Oculus Touch and I did manage to figure most things out and once I did, I couldn't get over the immersion. Getting distance is a challenge with club speed but once you figure out the sweet spot it's a great "Sim" that any golf aficionado will truly love.

10/10 would throw my clubs in the water hazard again

EDIT: Feb 8, 2017 - someone figured out how to change the button callouts for Touch users in this latest update. I'm buying that guy a steak dinner. Previously, to line up at ball or move around you had to push a direction on joystick, then push the joystick in. The controller is pretty much worn out from this seemingly bizaar configuration and my thumb can't take any more. This update is money and a game changer as a Rift owner. I sobbed uncontrollably for several minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253748581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1522159792}
review:
[h1]The best VR experience right now[/h1]

This game is unbelievably good. If you're vaguely into golf it's a no-brainier. I'm a 9 handicapper and this game (with the swing analysis) turned my fade into a draw in real life! 
It's the most fun I've had with my Vive, and for £18.99 (at the time of this review) it's an absolute steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282504464', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1692999962}
review:
Almost a great game.  All the flaws in my real life game are back with a vengeance in VR.  The frustration of the real game is there but being able to teleport means you can spend more time striking balls and less time walking.  I am pretty confident mastering this would improve your real life game.

So why only "almost a great game" then?   At present there are no practise options.  It gets a bit frustraring having to restart a new round just to take another practise swing.  Add a driving range that gives some guidance on improving your swing and this game has nailed it.  With that added it would take a pretty amazing game to knock this off top spot for VR golf simulation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992969656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1488978376}
review: i also bought tis for Oculus Touch its not good i love golf and tryed for 3 hours to make it work, its not good trust me, VERY frustrating when so many says its awesome, and it works for touch, its playable kind of, but not really

author: {'steamid': '76561198160151947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1703963102}
review:
The game is a very good rendition of golf, only there are points that need to be addressed,
1. Multiplayer
2. Clubs give wrong yardage: 4 iron hits shorter thatn a 5 iron
3. Yardage on big scoreboard is different to controller yardage ie scorecard 125 & controller 142
4. Gradient marking does not cover all of the green on very long puts

I will keep looking but it would be  nice for an update to correct these in 2017

Otherwise kepp up the good work, I love the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037510879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1494227594}
review:
Absolutely incredible. This game is incredibly polished and very well done, with one of the most thorough and helpful tutorials I've ever seen in a VR game.

Optimization needs HUGE work. I'm playing on an i7-4930k and GTX 1080 and even going to medium settings will be sacrificing fluid gameplay and framerates. A real shame, becuase high settings look great despite the fact that almost no computer can run it stable right now.

The recent update with ghost balls has [i]basically[/i] made this multiplayer. You can see your friends ball moving around the map as well as their score, all that's missing is an avatar to represent them as a player.

The maps look incredible, but we definitely need a better variety in difficulty levels. I have yet to see a map that's [i]not[/i] labeled as "Hardest Difficulty". I highly doubt I'm not the only player who can't play worth a damn and ends every course with scores +50 above par. A more straightforward selection of beginner courses would be great for easing into it.

Also wouldn't mind perhaps an eventual tutorial or "trainer" to teach you posture and how to swing and aim and respond to wind and such. Also, a tutorial to teach you the difference between the different clubs would be great. Just because I know how to hit a ball with a club doesn't mean I know what the different numbers and angles do!

tl;dr - Presence is fantastic, simulation is incredible, performance/optimization needs vast improvement, it's basically got multiplayer, learning curve is very steep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350628983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1482451163}
